title: Thesis Work - Bridging Minds and Machines: Eliciting Tacit Knowledge for Smarter AI through UX Design
description:
W ABB pomagamy przemysłowi wyprzedzać konkurencję - działać sprawniej i ekologicznie. U nas postęp to standard – dla Ciebie, Twojego zespołu i całego świata. Jako globalny lider dajemy Ci to, czego potrzebujesz, by to osiągnąć. Nie zawsze będzie łatwo, rozwój wymaga determinacji. Ale w ABB nigdy nie będziesz działać sam. Zarządzaj tym, co porusza świat.


Stanowisko to podlega:


R&D Team Lead  

In recent years, the rapid development of AI solutions has significantly impacted various industries, including process industries, where AI is expected to assist operators in decision-making. However, several challenges remain in making AI truly beneficial for operators, where one major issue is the lack of diversified and high-quality data for AI training. Relying solely on manuals and documents is often insufficient and assimilating complex operational data is a time consuming and requires vast data science competence. Even with the advancements of data engineering it is apparent that there are deficiencies of industrial information exist, due to limited sensing and digitalization.


To tackle the problem, some research suggests that incorporating tacit knowledge from human experts into AI systems could improve decision-making by making AI more adaptable and better at handling ambiguity and uncertainty.


Tacit knowledge is spontaneous, intuitive, experimental, everyday knowledge, and it includes a range of conceptual and sensory information as well as images which can be exercised as an attempt to make something meaningful. However, the process of capturing tacit knowledge and converting it into explicit information suitable for AI training remains underexplored.

  

In addition, heavy industries will face a big transformation in the future when experienced workers retire, and new generation will become the major workforce. Experienced human workers often rely heavily on tacit knowledge to help them make decisions in operations. Those precious tacit knowledge experienced workers have gained throughout the years will be at a risk of getting lost. How to maintain the knowledge and transfer them to younger workforce will be a key issue for many companies in the industries.


This thesis will focus on exploring UX design or framework for capturing tacit knowledge of domain experts through interacting with AI agents, to help AI/ML generate best practices or standardized workflows.

**Recommended research questions are:**

* What are users’ requirements and needs for using AI agents to capture operators’ tacit knowledge during their daily tasks?
* How to design human AI interaction to enable and motivate knowledge sharing for expert users during their daily interaction with AI systems?
	+ How does an ideal UX flow look like?
	+ What are design implications for designing such AI agents?
	+ What are the potential risks and challenges faced by users when interacting with AI systems designed to capture and utilize tacit knowledge?

**Details**

* Period: Spring 2026, typically between January and July
* Number of credits: 30 ECTS
* Number of students: 1 - 2
* Location: Västerås, hybrid work possible

**Your responsibilities**

* Literature review on tacit knowledge elicitation, and human AI interaction for knowledge elicitation
* Conduct user studies to understand potential user needs, using methods such as expert or user interviews (ABB internal experts or operators in plants)
* Create concepts based on learning and assumptions
* Implement prototypes (fidelity can be flexible)
* Conduct user evaluation (optional)
* Summarize results and identify design implications on using AI agent to conduct tacit knowledge elicitation
  

**Your background**
We are looking for motivated master's students with a strong interest in human-centered design and automation.


Candidates could have:

* Academic Background in one or more of the following fields:
	+ Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)
	+ Interaction Design
	+ Human Factors Engineering
	+ Cognitive Psychology or Behavioral Science
	+ Systems Design or Ergonomics
	+ Socio-Technical Systems
* Ability to conduct user research and translate insights into concrete concepts
* Ability to make quick prototype (ideally have skills to create high fidelity prototypes), using Figma or other tools to create interactive prototype
* Able to approach challenges proactively and creatively, integrating user-centered approaches with technological advancements
* Ideally to have interests or previous experience in the topic of human AI interaction and knowledge conversion between human users and AI
* Big plus if you are familiar with SQL / NoSQL or other languages for storing and querying knowledge databases (not mandatory)

**More about us**


ABB is a global technology leader in electrification and automation. We see our purpose as being to enable a more sustainable and resource-efficient future. By connecting our engineering and digitalization expertise, we help industries run at high performance, while becoming more efficient, productive and sustainable so they outperform. We call this: ‘Engineered to Outrun.’

Apply with your CV, academic transcripts and a cover letter in English. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Relationsskapande dataanlytiker som leder utvecklingen tillsammans med andra!
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


Vi jobbar med att skapa ett team som kan vara med och bygga Sveriges bästa analysteam - villl du vara med?
  

  

Som utvecklingsledare och kravanalytiker i vårt analysteam kommer du att:  

* Översätta verksamhetens behov till spårbara krav, användarresor och acceptanskriterier som sedan blir mätbara nyckeltal.
* Kartlägga processer och information, definiera målbild och beroenden.
* Säkra kravstyrning genom hela livscykeln, ändringshantering, spårbarhet till test och leverans.
* Samverka med CTO/arkitektur, UX och analytiker; stöd i test och validering.
* Dokumentera tydligt på rätt detaljnivå för beslut och utveckling.

  

Om grundskoleförvaltningen - förändringsresa 2025
  

  

Under 2024-2025 har vi genomfört en större omorganisation för att stärka helhet, tydlighet och samordning med målet att bli en modern, effektiv och lärande förvaltning. Vi går från en renodlad linjeorganisation till en matrisorganisation och strävar efter mer agila och självorganiserande arbetssätt där självorganisering och självledarskap är nyckelfenomen.
  

  

Om enheten för utveckling och transformation
  

  

Enheten startade den 1 januari 2025 i samband med omorganisationen. Vi är ett tvärfunktionellt team med tydlig nybyggaranda där utvecklingsledare, analytiker, kommunikatörer och teknikspecialister verkar tillsammans. Vårt uppdrag är transformerande: att etablera moderna arbetssätt, bygga förmågor och leverera lösningar som håller i vardagen från strategi till praktik. Här trivs du som vill vara med och skapa nytt, testa, lära och skala det som fungerar.  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig som har:
  

* Flera års erfarenhet av dataanalys och kravarbete
* Kunskap om metodik för process- och kravhantering, datamodellering och spårbarhet.
* Erfarenhet om agila metoder och förmåga att driva worksops, projekt och processer för utveckling.
* Mycket god dokumentations- och kommunikationsförmåga.
* Högskoleutbildning inom för tjänsten relevant område eller utbildning som vi finner likvärdig.

  

Meriterande:
  

* Erfarenhet av datadrivna lösningar/BI och beslutsstöd exempelis Qlik, Power BI och AI drivna lösningar.

  

Personliga kompetenser:
  

* Analytisk och konsekvent du säkrar spårbarhet och kvalitet i varje steg.
* Flexibel och utvecklingsorienterad med fokus på agila förhållningssätt.
* Kommunikativ brobyggare du får verksamhet och teknik att förstå varandra.
* Process- och metodtrogen du dokumenterar och använder relevanta överenskomna metoder för utveckling.
**Övrig information**
---------------------


Inför denna rekrytering har vi tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och därför undanber vi oss ytterligare erbjudanden om kompetensförmedling, annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.
  

  

Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem.
  

  

Rekryteringsprocess: I denna rekrytering efterfrågar vi inte personligt brev du besvarar kompetensfrågor direkt i systemet. Tjänsten tillsätts under förbehåll att rätt kandidat hittas och att inte interna skäl förhindrar tillsättning.
**Om Grundskoleförvaltningen**
------------------------------


Vi skapar framtiden i Göteborg – en lektion i taget  

  

Varje vardag möts tusentals barn och unga i våra skolor – med dem formar vi framtidens Göteborg. I grundskoleförvaltningen är vi 10 000 engagerade medarbetare som jobbar tillsammans för att alla elever ska få lyckas och växa, oavsett bakgrund eller förutsättningar. Du har en viktig roll i att skapa en likvärdig skola med hög kvalitet, där du både får utvecklas och utveckla verksamheten. Du bygger kunskap, gemenskap och framtidstro tillsammans med dina kollegor. Hos oss får du vara med och göra skillnad – på riktigt.  

  

Göteborgs grundskoleförvaltning ansvarar för stadens närmare 140 kommunala skolor, från förskoleklass till årskurs 9, anpassad grundskola, fritidshem och Kulturskola. Välkommen att arbeta nära skogen, staden eller havet. Vi är Göteborg.

title: UX-designer sökes till spännande uppdrag i Lund
description:
**Beskrivning**


Vår klient i Lund söker nu en UX Designer till sitt team. Rollen innebär att arbeta i ett agilt och innovationsdrivet utvecklingscentrum med fokus på att skapa användarvänliga digitala lösningar som möter verkliga behov. Som UX Designer blir du en del av ett team där samarbetet med utvecklare och andra designresurser är centralt för att leverera produkter av hög kvalitet.

**Arbetsuppgifter**


I rollen som UX Designer kommer du att genomföra användarundersökningar, intervjuer och tester för att förstå användarnas behov och översätta dessa till konkreta designlösningar. Du arbetar med design av användargränssnitt för digitala verktyg och applikationer, både genom att vidareutveckla befintliga grafiska riktlinjer och skapa nya designlösningar. Du samarbetar nära utvecklare för att säkerställa att design implementeras korrekt och bidrar till att leverera högkvalitativ grafik och användarupplevelser. Arbetet sker i en agilt miljö där metoder som Scrum, Kanban, Lean UX och Design Sprint används.

**Kvalifikationer**

* Stark användarfokus med driv att förstå och möta användarnas behov


* Erfarenhet av användarundersökningsmetoder, exempelvis intervjuer och användbarhetstestning

  


* Mycket goda sociala färdigheter och förmåga att omvandla insikter till designbeslut

  


* Mycket goda kunskaper i UI-verktyg, främst Figma; kunskaper i Photoshop och Illustrator är meriterande

  


* Erfarenhet av design för digitala verktyg och applikationer

  


* Förmåga att vidareutveckla befintlig design samt skapa nya designlösningar i linje med grafiska riktlinjer

  


* Förmåga att samarbeta med utvecklare och leverera grafik för utvecklingsändamål

  


* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agil miljö eller med Lean UX/Design Sprint

  


* Ödmjuk men självsäker inställning med förståelse för hur data och intuition påverkar designbeslut

**Meriterande**


* Vissa kodningskunskaper är meriterande, men inte ett krav


**Villkor**


Rollen utförs på på plats hos vår klient i Lund. Sysselsättningsgrad är heltid. Uppdragsperioden sträcker sig från 1 november 2025 till 31 december 2026.


Om du är redo att ta dig an en roll som UX Designer inom tillverkningssystem och bidra till att skapa användarvänliga och innovativa digitala lösningar, tveka inte att söka. Vi rekryterar kontinuerligt och ser fram emot din ansökan!

 **Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post på grund av GDPR.**  

**För att din ansökan ska kunna behandlas ber vi dig därför att skicka in den via vår** **karriärsida**

title: UX Designer to assignment in Malmö
description:
We’re currently looking for a skilled UX Designer to join an innovative team within the global retail industry. This assignment focuses on rebuilding a digital product that supports retail concept assessments across a wide network of customer meeting points. The goal? To empower store co-workers and retail leaders through an intuitive tool that drives quality, consistency, and continuous improvement.
  
The assignment is full-time (32-40 hours per week), starting as soon as possible and running until 15 February 2026. The role is based in Malmö with an on-site presence required 2–3 days per week.
  
Please note that CV and portfolio (pdf or link) is required to apply for this position.
  
**About the role:** As a UX Designer, you’ll join a newly formed product team working to reimagine the end-to-end digital journey for retail assessments. From defining user needs to delivering elegant design solutions, you’ll help build a product from the ground up that enhances operational efficiency and supports retail excellence. Reporting to a Digital Product Leader, you'll work closely with developers, researchers, and retail experts to simplify a complex and highly impactful process.
  
**Responsibilities:** Translate user insights and business needs into intuitive digital experiences that support retail assessments
  
Design user-friendly interfaces for complex workflows, ensuring scalability and accessibility
  
Collaborate with researchers to conduct usability testing and validate design decisions
  
Work closely with developers and product stakeholders to align design work with product strategy
  
Develop wireframes, prototypes, and visual designs using tools like Figma and Miro
  
Apply and contribute to the design system to ensure consistency across platforms
  
Continuously iterate on design solutions based on user feedback and analytics
  
Support a culture of collaboration, feedback, and learning within the product team
  
  

**About you:**  

You are a UX Designer with at least five years of experience including designing scalable digital products. Your expertise lies in simplifying complex systems and creating solutions that are both functional and user-centric. You’re naturally collaborative and thrive in cross-functional teams. Your ability to advocate for the user and translate insights into actionable design makes you a valuable contributor in a product-driven environment. Experience with enterprise tools or operational systems is a strong advantage.
  
**Experience and skills:** 5+ years of UX design experience
  
Proven ability to translate complex processes into intuitive digital interfaces
  
Strong skills in wireframing, prototyping, and visual design (Figma, Miro, Framer)
  
Experience working with design systems in a collaborative product environment
  
Ability to work closely with developers, researchers, and stakeholders
  
Strong communication skills and a user-first mindset
  
Comfortable conducting or collaborating on usability testing
  
Professional fluency in English is required
  
  

About the assignment
  
For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.

title: Produktägare till UR:s appteam i Stockholm
description:
Vill du vara med och öppna dörrar till nya kunskapsvärldar?
  
  

Sök rollen som produktägare för UR Plays appar för mobil och smart-tv!
  
Här får du chansen att göra skillnad för både dagens och morgondagens lärande. Som public service-bolag skapar vi digitala tjänster som ger människor kunskap för livet – utan att styras av reklamintäkter. I rollen får du kombinera strategiskt ansvar med operativ ledning i en kreativ miljö.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig
  
  

Hos UR kombinerar du teknik, produktutveckling och samhällsnytta i en miljö som präglas av tvärfunktionellt samarbete och ett högre syfte. Här får du:
  
  

utveckla tjänster som inte bara är roliga och utmanande, utan som också ger människor kunskap för livet
  
rollen som produktägare för välkända, uppskattade produkter som dagligen används över hela Sverige
  
kombinera tekniskt kunnande med samhällsnytta och samtidigt bidra till vårt viktiga public service-uppdrag
  
en öppen och inkluderande arbetskultur med högt i tak, där vi är måna om trygghet och ett respektfullt arbetsklimat
  
möjlighet att arbeta i ett team som med stort ansvar, frihet och glädje samverkar nära för att skapa en grym produkt
  
  

Det här gör du hos oss
  
  

I din roll som produktägare för vårt appteam ansvarar du för UR Play på iOS och Android samt för vår smart-tv-app som utvecklas av en extern leverantör. Dina uppgifter inkluderar att:
  
  

leda och inspirera teamet som redan har ett starkt driv, stor kompetens och ett genuint engagemang i sina produkter. Din roll är att säkerställa att vision och utvecklingsriktning för appen alltid är tydlig och levande
  
tillsammans med teamet kontinuerligt analysera användarbeteenden, sätta relevanta mätetal och initiera A/B-tester för att driva produktens utveckling utifrån data, insikter och användarfeedback
  
organisera planering, genomföra uppskattade retrospektiv och hantera teamets backlog och roadmap
  
ansvara för dialog med relevanta intressenter, både internt och externt
  
sätta roadmap och följa upp utvecklingen av smart-tv-appen med vår externa leverantör
  
  

Ditt team och din arbetsplats
  
  

Vi är en enhet med över 20 engagerade individer som arbetar i flera agila team. Vår mångsidighet sträcker sig över olika erfarenheter, kompetenser, åldrar och kön. Vi är utvecklare, UX/UI-designers, tjänstedesigner och produktägare. Vi samarbetar tvärfunktionellt med andra på UR för att skapa meningsfulla digitala produkter. Du kommer att tillhöra app-teamet som består av två Android-utvecklare, två iOS-utvecklare, en UX-designer och en UI-designer.
  
  

Ljust och öppet kontor vid Gärdet
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag och friskvårdstimme
  
  

Friskvårdsanläggning inkl. gym och träningspass
  
  

Företagshälsovård + fri sjukvård
  
  

Trygg anställning med kollektivavtal
  
  

Mer om dig
  
  

Vi söker dig med en naturlig förmåga att skapa goda samarbeten, som har lätt för att bygga relationer och inger en varm och mänsklig stämning i teamet. Du lyssnar in andras perspektiv, har ett öppet sinne och ser värdet av att kommunicera tydligt och respektfullt.
  
  

Du bidrar till en positiv och hållbar arbetskultur där alla känner sig inkluderade och sedda. Du samarbetar tätt med utveckling, analys och UX för att hela teamet ska utvecklas tillsammans. Att kunna ta välavvägda beslut, tydliggöra riktning och stötta teamet mot gemensamma mål är en viktig del av din stil. Du vågar vara tydlig när det behövs och ser till att driva arbetet framåt i både stora och små frågor. Din analytiska förmåga och intresse för hur omvärlden påverkar vårt arbete ser vi som en tillgång.
  
  

**Vi tror att du har:**  

dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med produktutveckling av appar för iOS, Android och/eller smart-tv
  
flerårig erfarenhet av produktägarskap, digital utveckling och agila metoder
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av streamingtjänster (audio, podd, video) eller erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning och samordning av externa partners.
  
  

Så här ansöker du
  
  

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta vår rekryterare Sandra Peiper på 070-956 39 46. Fackliga frågor på UR besvaras av Unionen, Saco och Journalistförbundet, samtliga nås genom UR: s växel på 08-784 40 00.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan. Skicka in din ansökan idag då urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning kan ske före sista ansökningsdag.
  
  

På UR förenas vi i vår passion att skapa kunskap för livet – för de många och de få. I vårt unika uppdrag kombinerar vi berörande journalistik med effektiv pedagogik och stöttar skolan och allmänheten med oberoende och pålitlig kunskap, och vi är stolta över det positiva bidrag vårt arbete har.
  
  

På UR får vår nyfikenhet och kreativitet spelrum. Vår omväxlande vardag gör vårt arbete både roligt och spännande. Hos oss är det lätt att vara människa på jobbet. Tillsammans skapar vi en välkomnande, positiv och prestigelös kultur. Vi vill varandra väl, och stöttar varandra i stort som smått. För att du ska må bra och nå din fulla potential erbjuder vi flexibiliteten att lägga livspusslet och få ett hållbart arbetsliv. Sammantaget gör detta oss till en schysst arbetsplats.
  
  

Vi värdesätter allas olikheter, för det är samspelet mellan vår bredd av kompetenser, personligheter och bakgrunder som är grunden i vår framgång.
  
  

Sandra Peiper | Kontaktperson

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
We look for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. So, if you want to make the world say wow, let's talk.
The conversation starts here. If this role matches your ambitions and skillset, let's get started with your application. Take a look at our other open positions too. Our many opportunities can lead to infinite possibilities.  

* Are you a passionate UX/UI designer who wants to work closely with a dedicated development team?
* Do you want to help employees get the most out of their workdays and reduce their everyday hassles?


If this applies to you, then we encourage you to apply for a role as a Designer in the Nimway team at Sony.* Please note: we cannot provide sponsorship for this position, please only apply if you have the right to live and work in Sweden.


About Sony Nimway
Sony Nimway is a smart office solution designed to help organizations create more efficient, engaged, and people-first workplaces. Originally developed for Sony’s own offices, Nimway is now used by global companies across industries such as pharmaceuticals, banking, telecom, retail, construction, and many more.
We’re building solutions that shape the future of workplace experiences. Our cross-platform products—spanning mobile apps (iOS & Android), web, analytics, room tablets, room and desk sensors, people-counting devices, and air quality monitoring—empower organizations to create smarter, healthier, and more efficient workplaces.
As part of Sony Network Communications Europe (SNCE), we operate like a scaleup within a large multinational enterprise - combining agility and innovation with the stability and global reach of Sony. See here for more information: www.sonynetworkcom.com/nimway.
Your Role
We’re looking for a UX/UI Designer who’s passionate about crafting intuitive, user-centred experiences. You’ll play a key role in researching user needs, designing wireframes and mockups, and shaping the look and feel of both new and existing features across our product ecosystem. Working closely with product managers, developers, and other teams, you’ll help us deliver seamless experiences across platforms—from employee-facing apps to sophisticated analytics tools.
What You’ll Be Doing* Conduct research and analyze user behaviors, needs, and problems to improve the solution based on data informed design.
* Comfortable collaborating with cross-functional teams to help define product specifications and influence future directions.
* Develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for new features as well as ongoing product enhancements for our cross-platform experiences—mobile (iOS, Android), web, room tablets, floorplans, and analytics.
* Transition UX flows and mockups to high fidelity UI design
* Partner with product managers and developers to ensure user needs align with business objectives.
* Test and validate design concepts through user research and feedback to deliver experiences that truly resonate.
* Continuously expand your skills, exploring innovative solutions, tools, and methods to boost efficiency and creativity.
* Work with and support the marketing team with high-quality concept mockups and feature screenshots.
* Capture and edit product videos to showcase features and functionality.
* Review floorplan layouts to ensure consistency and high product quality.
* Test features and perform quality checks across all platforms (iOS, Android, web, and analytics).


What We’re Looking For* Hold a relevant degree in UX/UI Design or a related field.
* Bring 3+ years of experience designing modern UX/UI for enterprise software (web and mobile).
* Expertise in Figma (or similar) and comfortable working with design systems.
* Enjoy both UX and UI, creating user-centred and visually engaging solutions.
* Collaborate effectively with developers, translating research and requirements into wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
* Are passionate about driving UX/UI design forward, self-motivated, and ready to take ownership—playing a key role in shaping the future of our design function with minimal guidance.
* Value user research and data-driven design decisions.
* Are skilled in Adobe suite and comfortable creating various marketing materials.
* Work in a structured, meticulous, and proactive way, always seeking innovative solutions.
* Are fluent in English and Swedish.


Your new office:
Malmö, Sweden
Our office in Malmö is an original working space dedicated to creating innovative technology for the next generation of business. Inside, experience greenery, smart office features and a forward-thinking office layout to explore new ways of working – designed collaboratively with employees. Outside, take in the panoramic view over southern Sweden, the Øresund strait and metropolitan Copenhagen. The building, The Point, is located in the new, sustainable city district of Hyllie and is conveniently accessible via public transport.
Equal Opportunity
Sony Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, or any other protected characteristics.
Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony Europe
Sony Europe will provide reasonable accommodation for any qualified individuals with disabilities in the application process. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at AccommodationRequest@eu.sony.com or by mail to: Sony Europe Limited, Human Resources Department, the Heights, Brooklands, Surrey, KT13 0XW, UK. When contacting us please indicate the position you are applying for, and the accommodation required.
#LI-CM1
company_description: Sony Corporation of America, located in New York City, is the U.S. headquarters of Sony Corporation, based in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Product Manager -Commercial
description:
Om Carla Vi vill accelerera omställningen till hållbar mobilitet. Det gör vi genom att erbjuda det mest kundvänliga sättet att sälja och köpa elbilar. Vårt mål är att bli Norra Europas största aktör inom försäljning av elbilar. Vi grundades i Stockholm 2020, och är idag näst störst i Sverige inom försäljning av begagnade elbilar. Under 2025 siktar vi på en försäljningsvolym på 2 miljarder kronor med lönsamhet, samtidigt som vi fortsätter ha Sveriges nöjdaste kunder.
  
  

**Vår affärsmodell bygger på att:**  

Köpa och sourca bilar från privatpersoner, företag och partners som banker, leasingbolag och tillverkare.
  
Erbjuda en helt digital kundresa via carla.se kombinerat med personlig service från våra säljare.
  
Säkerställa hög kvalitet och lönsamhet genom effektiva interna processer, stark dataanvändning och egna system.
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som Product Manager – Commercial på Carla får du en central roll i att utveckla de digitala verktyg och kundupplevelser som driver vår kommersiella affär framåt. Du kommer att arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan teknik, design och affärsutveckling – och kombinera insikter från sälj, inköp, finans, management, marknad och såklart kunder för att skapa smarta, hållbara lösningar, både för mötet med kund online samt på telefon, chat, e-post, mm.
  
**Rollen är bred:** ditt arbete handlar dels om att förbättra interna kommersiella processer och system – som vårt interna BackOffice, Hubspot (CRM) och integrationer mot affärssystemet Business Central. Arbetet handlar dels om att utveckla vår konsumentsajt carla.se, där du tillsammans med utvecklare, designer, marknad och eCommerce manager optimerar konvertering, försäljning och kundupplevelse.
  
Du kommer att kartlägga och analysera processer tillsammans med användare för att förstå rotorsaker till problem innan ni designar lösningar. Din förmåga att kombinera service design, interaktionsdesign och produktledning gör att du kan skapa flöden som fungerar lika bra för interna team som för kunder. Du får en viktig roll i att förtydliga problem, facilitera diskussioner och leda tvärfunktionella beslut.
  
Du rapporterar till CPTO och arbetar tätt med tech lead och utvecklingsteamet (som är remote), samt med säljare, inköpare, värderare, finansteam, management och marknad på kontoret i Stockholm.
  
Dina ansvarsområden
  
Identifiera, analysera och prioritera behov inom Commercial tillsammans med sälj, inköp, finans, management och marknad.
  
Kartlägga och förbättra processer med hjälp av service design-metoder.
  
Leda utveckling av nya funktioner i våra interna system och i carla.se.
  
Samarbeta tätt med designer, utvecklare och stakeholders i tvärfunktionella projekt.
  
Säkerställa att lösningar är välanpassade, skalbara och ger konkret affärsnytta.
  
Arbeta med konverteringsoptimering, kundinsikter och feedbackverktyg.
  
Ansvara för roadmap, prioritering och kommunikation av teamets arbete.
  
  

Vem vi söker
  
Vi letar efter dig som kombinerar affärsförståelse med stark process- och designkänsla. Du trivs i en miljö där du får jobba både affärsutvecklande och hands-on, och gillar att få saker gjorda. Du är trygg i att facilitera diskussioner, tydliggöra problem och skapa struktur i komplexa flöden.
  
  

**Vi tror att du har:**  

Flera års erfarenhet som Product Manager eller liknande roll. Dokumenterad vana att kartlägga och förbättra processer tillsammans med användare.
  
Erfarenhet av att ta fram och validera UX-design (tillsammans med eller utan designer).
  
Intresse för service design och interaktionsdesign.
  
Vana av att leda utvecklingsteam (remote)
  
Förmåga att balansera kommersiella mål med interna effektiviseringsbehov.
  
God förmåga att kommunicera och förenkla komplex information.
  
Vana och förståelse av vikten av release management - att utbilda, kontrollerat rulla ut och följa upp releaser
  
Talar flytande svenska och engelska
  
  

**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**  

E-handel eller annan digital försäljning.
  
CRM- och affärssystem som Hubspot eller Business Central.
  
Konverteringsoptimering och A/B-testning.
  
User research med både kvalitativa och kvantitativa metoder
  
Automatisering eller AI-drivna verktyg i kommersiella flöden.
  
  

Plats och arbetssätt
  
Rollen är baserad på vårt kontor i Vasastan i Stockholm, nära dina stakeholders och en del av det bredare produktteamet. Möjligheter finns för visst remotearbete.

title: UX/UI Designer – Consulting Assignment in Lund
description:
We are now looking for a passionate and creative UX/UI Designer for an exciting assignment within manufacturing systems. You will join an experienced agile team that values innovation and user-centered design.


**About the role**  

You’ll be part of a global development team working with agile methods such as Scrum, Kanban, Lean UX, and Design Sprints. In this role, you’ll shape and improve digital tools and applications — from research and concept development to final design delivery.

**Main responsibilities**

* Conduct user research and usability testing
* Translate insights into meaningful design solutions
* Design user interfaces using Figma (Photoshop and Illustrator are a plus)
* Develop and refine UI according to established design guidelines
* Collaborate closely with developers and other team members
* Deliver graphical assets for implementation
* Contribute ideas and creative solutions in an agile environment
* 

**We’re looking for someone who has**

* Experience with user interviews, usability testing, and UX research
* Excellent skills in Figma
* Ability to design based on existing graphical guidelines
* Experience working in agile teams (Scrum, Lean UX, or Design Sprint)
* Some coding knowledge is an advantage, but not required

**Assignment details**  

Start date: November 1, 2025  

End date: December 31, 2026  

Workload: 100%  

Location: Lund (on-site, no remote work)  

  



Please send your CV in English.


Sway Sourcing is an innovative recruitment partner specializing in matching the right talent with the right company—quickly and efficiently. Our primary focus lies in Finance, Administration, HR, Marketing, and IT, but we also have the broad expertise and flexibility required to deliver tailored recruitment solutions across all industries.


Although we are a relatively new player, we have already gained the trust of many of Sweden's largest companies and operate both nationally and internationally. With bases in Sweden and Spain, we offer a unique combination of local expertise and global reach. Our strong network and deep industry insights make us the obvious partner for companies looking to stay ahead in their recruitment efforts.

title: Senior UX Engineer
description:
Kunden och Sektionen Bastjänster har ett stort behov att knyta ihop tekniska lösningar med användarbehov och design. En Senior UX-designer som ligger väldigt nära kod och kan coacha teamen och skapa förutsättningar för att lösningarna möter krav på tillgänglighet, DevOps och kod.


Uppdragsbeskrivning Uppdraget innebär att konsulten kommer att arbeta på olika nivåer inom organisation. Både kopplat till UX/UX/Design delar och med användare, tester och prototyper men även kunna koda och föda vårt Designsystem med komponenter vid behov. Konsulten förväntas vara pedagogisk och en informell ledare för mindre erfarna anställda.

**SKA-KRAV**

  

* Kunskap – hög generalistkompetens, eller mycket hög kompetens inom aktuell roll.
* Erfarenhet – har utfört komplexa uppdrag inom aktuell roll och genomfört konsulttjänst med mycket hög kvalitet. Nivån uppnås normalt efter 9–12 år inom aktuell roll.
* Ledning – tar huvudansvar för ledning av större grupp.
* Självständighet – mycket stor.
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med UX-design för webbaplikationer
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att utveckla i Angular och/eller React
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Designsystem inom offentlig verksamhet
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla webbkonponenter i Stencil.js
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med tillgänglighet inom offentlig sektor
* Avancerade kunskaper med utveckling i CSS/SCSS och preprocessors
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Figma inom offentlig verksamhet

**BÖR-KRAV**

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med webbkomponenter
* Erfarenhet av agil utveckling i tvärfunktionella team i stora organisationer
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utveckla designtokens
* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att handleda utvecklare och leveransteam
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med öppen källkod i utveckling, främst genom Designsystem.

title: CGI Artist
description:
CGI Artist Consultant to support advanced 3D visualization efforts, including both still imagery and animation/video creation. You will collaborate closely with an internal Scania CGI specialist, forming a dedicated team that contributes throughout the entire design process from early concept development to industrialization across various platforms.


This role involves close interaction with the interior and exterior industrial design teams, CMF (Color, Material, Finish), Visual Graphics, and other cross-functional teams. The CGI team plays a vital role in enhancing the product User Experience (UX) and delivering a premium design experience within the context of sustainable heavy transport.


Key Responsibilities  

* Create photorealistic still imagery in both studio and product application contexts.
* Produce high-quality animations/videos for design and communication purposes.
* Support real-time visualization during design reviews and fixed deliveries.
* Enable VR visualization using multi-headset setups.
* Contribute to process and tool development for efficient, high-quality iterations.
* Participate in agile workflows with 10-week PI (Program Increment) planning.

Tools & Technologies:  

* Primary tools: Autodesk VRED, Blender, After Effects
* Emerging tools: Unreal Engine, Unity
* Experience with game engines and real-time rendering is highly valued.

Qualifications:  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Industrial Design, Visualization, or a related field.
* Proven experience in visualizing complex design projects.
* Automotive industry experience is a plus.
* Strong proficiency in the tools mentioned above.
* Exceptional visual communication and storytelling skills.

Success Factors:  

* Demonstrated ability to work in collaborative team environments.
* Agile mindset with adaptability to varying project conditions.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and visual.
* Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.

Other Requirements:  

* We expect Portfolio/Show Reel of previous work.

A background check will be carried out before any assignment starts.

title: Senior ML/AI Engineer
description:
**About Depict**  

  

Depict.ai is redefining the future of fashion e-commerce with AI. Founded by Oliver Edholm and Anton Osika, we’ve entered a new growth phase with products that our customers truly love. From AI-powered merchandising to GPT-driven search, we’re pioneering solutions that make e-commerce smarter, faster, and more personalized. Our customers span the Nordics, UK, USA and now, we’re looking for exceptional engineers to help us shape the next chapter.  

  

**The role:**  

  

We’re on the hunt for a Senior ML/AI Engineer to help us bring this vision to life. You'll be joining a lean, high-impact team with full ownership over everything from system architecture and modeling to infrastructure.  

  

If you're excited about working with LLMs, product search, and building innovative solutions from the ground up, we’d love to hear from you.  

  

We collaborate with some of the fastest-growing DTC brands and nine-figure online retailers across Europe and the U.S. Depict is backed by world-class investors including Y Combinator, Initialized, EQT Ventures, and Northzone.


**What You’ll Do**

* Support the development of LLM-powered conversational search—tuned for ecommerce catalogs, user behavior, and brand voice.
* Build advanced systems that combine RAG, semantic search, and multi-turn dialogue to handle real-world ambiguity.
* Architect pipelines that blend structured product data, reviews, and customer signals into compelling search experiences.
* Prototype with models like GPT, Mistral, LLaMA, or fine-tuned domain-specific models.
* Development across the full ML lifecycle—from training and embeddings infra to scalable inference.
* Collaborate with product and design to craft UX that feels magical, not generic.
* Define and run evaluation strategies—from offline metrics (e.g., Recall@K, nDCG) and human-in-the-loop feedback to online A/B testing tied to engagement and conversion.
* Build tooling to ingest, clean, and version product catalogs, reviews, and chat logs.
* Stay on top of research, and make smart calls on what to build vs. adopt.
* Ship fast, learn from usage, and balance startup speed with technical excellence.

**Who You Are**

* You’ve built and shipped production ML systems, especially in search, NLP, or conversational AI.
* You’re skilled in transformers, LLMs, vector search, and semantic retrieval.
* You’ve designed evaluation frameworks and know how metrics tie back to real user value.
* You work across the stack—modeling, APIs, data pipelines, infra, and even frontend.
* You thrive in early-stage environments, moving fast and wearing many hats.
* You care deeply about user experience, not just model accuracy.

**Bonus Points**

* Experience with multi-turn conversations, chat UIs, or personalization in search.
* Experience with fine-tuning, building or deploying machine learning models
* Familiarity with OpenAI, LLaMA, Mistral, or embedding models like E5 or Cohere.
* Worked on model safety, hallucination detection, or guardrails for generative apps.
* Exposure to quantization, PEFT, or retrieval tuning.
* You've measured success using both quantitative metrics and qualitative user feedback.
* Familiarity with safety/guardrails in generative applications.

**Why You’ll Love Working Here:**

* Competitive salary and meaningful equity opportunities.
* 30 days paid vacation + wellness and learning allowances.
* Work on the bleeding edge of AI in e-commerce.
* Collaborate with a tight-knit, ambitious team in Stockholm
* See the impact of your work on real customers around the world

title: UX Designer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Experience in user research methods, such as conducting interviews and usability testing.
* Very strong people skills with an understanding of user needs, and the ability to translate insights into meaningful design decisions.
* Very good knowledge in UI tools, primarily Figma. Photoshop and Illustrator is bonus.
* Experience in designing UI for digital tools and applications.
* The ability to understand, and create new design, based on graphical guidelines
* The ability to understand and build upon an existing design, take ownership of its completion, and create new design solutions in alignment with the established direction.
* The ability to collaborate with developers
* The ability to deliver graphics to be used in development
* A humble but confident attitude, with a good understanding and base in research how data and instinct play into decision making for the users.
* Experience of designing in an agile environment or working with Lean UX or Design Sprint.
* Some coding experience and competence can be an advantage, it is not required

 **Application deadline:** 20-10-2025

 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Product Design Lead Payments
description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of one of the largest and most important digital services in Sweden!


At Kivra, we are building services that connect over 6 million people with more than 50 000 senders in both the private and public sector. We provide a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. Millions of our users receive and pay their invoices in Kivra every month. And these numbers are growing rapidly.

**About the role**


As a Product Design Lead in Kivra's Payments team your job will be to ensure a holistic, human-centric approach to product development, shaping the domain UX/CX strategy, and coordinating design work. Payments is a strategic area of high importance for Kivra and we are investing to take a leading position.


Part of this role is to lead all aspects of the design process, from exploration to launch, ensuring an insight-driven approach, and following Kivra’s Design System. As a Product Design Lead Payments you will also:

* Scope, design and conduct qualitative and quantitative research and testing
* Partner with other cross-functional teams to align design solutions with business goals
* Contribute to shaping our people-first design culture and processes


We strongly believe that working in autonomous cross-functional teams is the best way to develop products. You will be at the very heart of that process. Together with the teams you will be responsible to deeply understand the needs of our users and customers and bring our visions to life, by collaborating cross-functionally with product owners, designers, developers, sales, and our partners, throughout the entire creative and development process.


As a Product Design Lead you will be working together with the two product teams in the Payments Domain and report to the Product Manager.


At Kivra we value great attitude. It’s as simple as that! You will work hands-on in a dynamic environment where both fast decision making and longer term strategy are part of the challenge.

**About you**

* You have 5+ experience as UX/Product designer.
* You have a Master’s degree in design or other relevant education.
* You have a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in UX research, strategy, and design.
* You have a broad understanding of people-centric methods and proficiency in design tools.
* You have excellent project management skills.

**Moreover, we believe that you**

* Are a strong communicator who can effectively share design decisions to leadership, across the organization, and to relevant external stakeholders.
* Thrive in an environment where transparent communication and short feedback loops are encouraged.
* Have excellent communication skills in English. Swedish is a plus.
* Have the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse professionals within and across product teams, skill teams, and departments.
* Are a team player, just like us!

It’s also a plus if you have experience from any of the following areas: payments and invoicing, invoice life cycle processes, or merchant checkouts.


At Kivra, we encourage a self-leadership approach based on a proactive mindset to problem-solving, well suited to our agile product development practice. Flexibility and adaptability are important qualities, to be able to adjust to changing circumstances and situations.

**We offer**


Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.


We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. We offer the flexibility that life sometimes requires, but we believe that collaboration and value creation happens best when we sit and work together from our office in central Stockholm.

**How to apply**


Easy peasy, just send in your CV and Portfolio as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**Join Our Team:**


Are you a passionate and experienced Senior UX Designer looking to shape the future of communication technology? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and possess a forward-thinking approach? If so, Ericsson is looking for you to join our dynamic Experience Design team in Kista and contribute to building cutting-edge solutions that transform the way people interact with technology. The Experience Design Team is involved in projects across various business areas and responsible for developing the Ericsson Design System (EDS), including its guidelines and UI patterns, and has been honored with seven international design awards, including the prestigious Red Dot Award and the iF Design Award, underscoring their ongoing commitment to design excellence.

  

Ready to make an impact? Apply now and be part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and excellence. Transform your ideas into reality with us.

 **About this opportunity:**


As a Senior UX Designer at Ericsson, you will play a key role in shaping the user experience for our products and services. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and researchers, to deliver intuitive, user-centered designs. You will also be at the forefront of integrating AI technologies into our design processes and solutions, ensuring we remain at the cutting edge of innovation.

  

This is an exciting opportunity to work onsite in our Kista office, contributing to impactful projects in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

 **What you will do:**

* Lead the end-to-end UX design process, from research and ideation to prototyping and final design delivery.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business goals, user needs, and technical constraints.
* Create wireframes, user flows, prototypes, and detailed UI designs to communicate design concepts effectively.
* Utilize AI technologies to enhance design operations and develop AI-powered user solutions.
* Conduct user research, usability testing, and analysis to validate design decisions and improve product experiences.
* Work closely with developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs.
* Mentor junior designers and contribute to fostering a culture of design excellence within the team.
* Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in UX and AI-driven design.

 **The skills you bring:**

* 5+ years of professional experience as a UX Designer, preferably in design agencies or innovative companies.
* A strong portfolio showcasing user-centered design solutions across a range of projects and industries.
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.
* Experience with AI technologies in the design process (e.g., AI-generated assets, data-driven design) or incorporating AI into user-facing solutions.
* Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, UX research methods, and usability testing.
* Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and communicate design concepts effectively.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation and continuous learning.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
 **Plus-to-Have Skills:**

* Experience designing for complex systems, such as enterprise, telecommunication platforms, and B2B services.
* Knowledge of front-end development principles (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to bridge the gap between design and development.
* Familiarity with accessibility standards and inclusive design practices.
* Experience with designing service blueprints for Software-as-a-Service solutions.

 **What We Offer:**

* An opportunity to work on impactful, cutting-edge projects in the telecommunications and tech industries.
* Collaboration with a diverse, talented, and innovative team.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment that values creativity and forward-thinking.
* Continuous learning and development opportunities to grow your expertise.

 **How to Apply:**


If you’re passionate about creating exceptional user experiences and leveraging the power of AI to shape the future of design, we’d love to hear from you! **Please submit your resume and portfolio showcasing your best work.** Join us at Ericsson and help us design the future! Join us at Ericsson and help us design the future!


Last date to apply: October 28th, 2025

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Req ID:** 774843
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Thesis Project - GUI/UX for Requirements Management in SystemWeaver
description:
*We are Zeekr Technology Europe. Powered by engineers and creative minds from all over the world. Located in Gothenburg, Sweden, one of the leading mobility innovation grounds worldwide. Established in 2013 as CEVT and began with the mission to create a revolutionary modular vehicle architecture, CMA. As of 2024, CEVT is now Zeekr Technology Europe, signaling our belonging within Zeekr. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today.*


Are you a **Master's student in GUI/UX** ready to apply your skills to a real-world engineering challenge? Join us to redefine the user experience for requirements management on the SystemWeaver platform.

**Project Description**:


The project will focus on the process of sending and receiving development requirements between teams. You will:

* Analyze and Document Use Cases: Define and document the complete set of user use cases and scenarios related to distributing, accepting, or rejecting requirements. This includes a process analysis of a key portion of the Zeekr Systems Engineering process.
	+ Potential Focus Areas: Depending on student interest and background, the process analysis may involve areas such as LLM-aided requirement elicitation, requirement traceability, E/E HW design, or variability management (for components, requirements, and parameters).
* GUI/UX Design Proposal: Define and document a proposed Graphical User Interface (GUI). The core focus is on User Experience (UX) to make the process intuitive, easy-to-use, and efficient for the end-user, ultimately reducing cognitive load within SystemWeaver.


**Your skills and background**

* Master's studies in Interaction Design & Technologies, Teknisk Design, or a similar program with proven GUI and UX design experience.
* Fluency in English and Swedish.
* Familiarity with SystemWeaver GUI

**Why you should join Zeekr Tech Eu**


We are engineers, developers, and innovators from around the world. Joined together by entrepreneurship, our unique blend of global culture, and a belief in a smarter more sustainable future. At Zeekr Tech Eu we fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions, doing your master thesis here is no different. We are convinced that a thesis project is a major contribution to our innovation capabilities and long-term development. You'll have a great opportunity to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what´s possible.

**What happens when you apply**  

If this sounds interesting and you match the requirements, please don't hesitate to submit your application with a CV and cover letter. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview to further discuss the project's details and expectations.

  


**This thesis project is intended for 1-2 students**

**Supervisor:** Dan-Erik Bergström, IT Application specialist System Weaver, dan-erik.bergstrom@zeekrtech.eu, please contact for more information about the project

 **Starting date:** January 2026

**Last application date: 2025-10-31**

  

Apply today. We will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you!


Please note that due to GDPR regulations, **we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system**, not via email or other channels.

title: Interim Digital Growth Manager
description:
**Om Boneo**


Boneo är en bostadsportal som ger en smidig genväg hem. Med branschens starkaste nätverk och smartaste tjänst, matchar vi rätt köpare och säljare.


Här hittar du bostäder till salu och kommande bostäder, eller På G som vi kallar dem, som i många fall publiceras först eller bara på Boneo. Dessutom matchas bostäder och nybyggnadsprojekt mot över 500 000 köpsugna personer som varit på visning av liknande bostäder just nu. Allt för att alla parter ska hitta rätt match.


Bakom Boneo står några av Sveriges största mäklarföretag – HusmanHagberg, Länsförsäkringar Fastighetsförmedling, Bjurfors, Mäklarhuset, SkandiaMäklarna, Svenska Mäklarhuset och Mäklarringen.  

  

**Vi är nu på jakt efter en driven och ambitiös person som kan axla rollen som vår Interim Digital Growth Manager under en 12-månaders period. Rollen innebär att ansvara för Boneos webbanalys och** **digitala trafikstrategi, och ta den** **till nästa nivå!**

 **Om rollen**


I rollen som Digital Growth Manager arbetar du inom alla områden som har med Boneos digitala trafikstrategi att göra, hur vi mäter och optimerar våra trafikkanaler och konverteringar. Även hur vi säkrar att vi förvaltar vår trafik och användarresor på bästa sätt, både med analys och förslag på ny produktutveckling och design. Kort och gott en bred roll med otrolig potential för den rätta personen!

**Notera att det är en interim-roll under en 12-månaders period.**

 **Arbetsuppgifter och ansvar**

* Analysera besöks- och användardata för att förstå hur de kan optimeras
* Optimera Boneos egna och våra partners leadsgenerering och konverteringar
* Analysera våra användar-resor och beteende på vår sajt och app, och ge konkreta förslag till produktteamet på förbättringar
* Arbeta med CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization)
* Arbeta med SEO både på strategisk och teknisk nivå, och säkra dess implementering och resultat
* Tillsammans med Boneos Marketing manager analysera resultat av betalda kampanjer, bygga målgrupper och hur trafik och besökare därifrån kan optimeras för konverteringar och andra satta nyckeltal
* Arbeta med alla steg i en besökares resa på Boneo
	+ Acquisition: Utforska och mäta kanaler och format för att förstå var och hur vi bäst når våra besökare och användare
	+ Aktivering: Ta reda på hur vi kan guida våra besökare till att så bra som möjligt förstå och uppskatta vår tjänst
	+ Retention: Optimera användarresan för att öka återkommande besökare och skapa positiv besöksupplevelse

 **Vad du kan**

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av **webbanalys och tracking,** gärna med erfarenhet av strategiskt arbete med digital tillväxt (ex. Web Analyst, Digital Analyst, Growth Manager).
* Djup erfarenhet av **GA4**.
* Erfarenhet av **Google Tag Manager**, inkl. grundläggande **server-side tracking**.
* Vana att sätta upp och kvalitetssäkra **tracking för webb och app**.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och analysera **dashboards** (ex. BigQuery, Looker Studio).
* Erfarenhet av **On-page** **SEO och teknisk SEO.**
* Erfarenhet av **A/B-testning och CRO.**
* Erfarenhet av **strategiskt arbete** med **trafikoptimering** och **digital tillväxt**
* Erfarenhet av att **tolka data** och **omsätta insikter** till konkreta tillväxtinitiativ och rekommendationer.
  

**Vem du är**

* Analytisk, datadriven och strukturerad.
* Noggrann, nyfiken och kreativ problemlösare.
* Resultatorienterad, självgående och handlingskraftig.
* Bekväm med att samarbeta med utvecklare och kommunicera tekniska behov.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska (verbalt och skriftligt)
* Gillar att jobba på både strategisk och på hands-on nivå, inte rädd för att kavla upp ärmarna när det behövs, det viktigaste är resultat!

  

**Verktyg vi använder och du behöver vara bekväm med**

* Google Tag Manager, inklusive server-side tracking
* Google Analytics 4 och Firebase
* BigQuery/andra databaser för analys
* Analytics Canvas
* Looker Studio/andra analysverktyg
* Hotjar, Smartlook/andra verktyg för användarobservation
* Refiner/andra verktyg för användarundersökningar
* Google Search Console
* Ahrefs, SEMrush/andra SEO-verktyg
* Convert Experience, Optimizely/andra A/B-testningsverktyg

 **Annan erfarenhet och kompetens som är ett plus:**

* **SQL, HTML, CSS** och **JavaScript**
* Kunskap inom **UX-design** och **användarresor**.
* Tidigare arbete i **startup- eller scaleup-miljö**.

 **Vad vi erbjuder dig**

* Vara del i ett snabbväxande bolag som ska förändra en hel bransch
* Arbeta med drivna, kompetenta kollegor med höga ambitioner
* En arbetsplats där möjligheten för din egna utveckling bara sätts av dig själv!

title: Product Designer
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.*
**Why Rebtel?**
 When you join Rebtel, you become part of a global team driven by a shared mission: to break down borders and build meaningful connects across the world. We take our work, and the people we build it for, seriously. Our Stockholm HQ reflects who we are: focused, collaborative and energized by a healthy dose of curiosity (and just the right amount of coffee).
   

  

**What will you do?**
 As a Product Designer at Rebtel you will bring strategic thinking and strong visual craft to the table. Someone who has the passion to turn real user needs into impactful, accessible and scalable design solutions. In this role, you will help shape intuitive user experience across mobile and web.
   

  

**Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Deliver and own high quality, user centered designs and features to elevate user experience as a whole.
* Partner with Senior Product Designer, Product Managers, and Engineers to iterate user experience from concept to launch.
* Create, collaborate and iterate on flows, prototypes and high-fidelity visuals.
* Contribute to evolving design system to support scalability across mobile app (iOS/Android) and web.
* Balance look and feel and user needs with business objectives and technical constraints.
* Ensure accessibility and usability standards are met across designs consistently.
* Build UI that supports localization requirements.
* Support research and testing to validate design decisions.
* Stay up to date with design and mobile app trends to inform design thinking and innovation.


**Requirements**
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role.
* Proficiency in Figma and similar tools for prototype, collaboration and documentation.
* Strong eye for visual and interaction design.
* Motion/interaction skills is a plus.
* Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) is a plus.
* Experience with user research, usability testing and A/B testing is a plus.
* Experience working in a rapidly changing environment.


**Our Offer To You**
**Benefits**
 At Rebtel, you are the most important asset and we strive to provide a comprehensive package of benefits and perks that enhance your well-being and work experience. Here are some of the things you can expect from us:
   

  

* Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and Travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental pay
* 30 days annual vacation
* Relocation Support, if you're joining us from afar, we'll assist you in making a smooth transition.


 Rebtel is an international workplace, and at the office, we speak English; therefore, high English proficiency is required.
   

  

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
   

  

 Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Nyfiken designer som vill bygga, testa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss.
 







  





**Det här är Brilliant Future** 




 Välkommen till Brilliant Future – ett SaaS-bolag mitt i en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi erbjuder en av marknadens ledande plattformar för kund- och medarbetarupplevelser. Med 20 års erfarenhet hjälper vi 600+ företag i 50 länder – och vi ska bli många fler. Nu söker vi en Product/UX Designer som vill vara med och forma framtidens användarupplevelser hos oss.
 







**Ditt uppdrag blir att** 



* Arbeta hands-on med design genom hela produkt-livscykeln, från research och prototyper till pixelperfekta gränssnitt.
* Bidra till och vidareutveckla Brilliants designsystem tillsammans med vårt produkt- och techteam.
* Samarbeta nära UX Lead, Product Manager, utvecklare och andra kollegor för att skapa enkla och smarta lösningar.
* Vara med och testa idéer med våra användare och omsätta feedback till förbättringar.



  





**Vi tror att du** 



* Har minst 1–2 års erfarenhet av UX- eller produktdesign
* Har relevant utbildning
* Har en bra grund i UX/UI och vill utvecklas i en miljö där design, data och AI möts
* Är nyfiken, prestigelös och gillar att arbeta tillsammans med andra
* Känner dig trygg i Figma och vill gärna utforska nya verktyg och arbetssätt
* Har en portfolio som visar på din förmåga att skapa tydliga och användarvänliga lösningar
* Bonus: intresse eller erfarenhet av UX writing.







  





**Hos oss får du** 



* Chansen att växa tillsammans med en erfaren UX Lead och ett team som brinner för datadriven produktutveckling.
* Ett designsystem och processer som du får vara med och vidareutveckla.
* Snabba vägar från idé till färdig design
* Härliga och engagerade kollegor som lever som vi lär och tar hand om varandra - och dessutom vill skapa produkter i världsklass.
* Kontor på Drottninggatan + flexibelt hybridupplägg.







  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 




 Fyll i formuläret och bifoga CV samt länk till portfolio. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



 💫

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
 



  





 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



  





 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



  





 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Join our Team**
**Join Our Team:**
 Are you a passionate and experienced Senior UX Designer looking to shape the future of communication technology? Do you thrive in a collaborative environment and possess a forward-thinking approach? If so, Ericsson is looking for you to join our dynamic Experience Design team in Kista and contribute to building cutting-edge solutions that transform the way people interact with technology. The Experience Design Team is involved in projects across various business areas and responsible for developing the Ericsson Design System (EDS), including its guidelines and UI patterns, and has been honored with seven international design awards, including the prestigious Red Dot Award and the iF Design Award, underscoring their ongoing commitment to design excellence.
   

  

 Ready to make an impact? Apply now and be part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and excellence. Transform your ideas into reality with us.
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 As a Senior UX Designer at Ericsson, you will play a key role in shaping the user experience for our products and services. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and researchers, to deliver intuitive, user-centered designs. You will also be at the forefront of integrating AI technologies into our design processes and solutions, ensuring we remain at the cutting edge of innovation.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity to work onsite in our Kista office, contributing to impactful projects in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Lead the end-to-end UX design process, from research and ideation to prototyping and final design delivery.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business goals, user needs, and technical constraints.
* Create wireframes, user flows, prototypes, and detailed UI designs to communicate design concepts effectively.
* Utilize AI technologies to enhance design operations and develop AI-powered user solutions.
* Conduct user research, usability testing, and analysis to validate design decisions and improve product experiences.
* Work closely with developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs.
* Mentor junior designers and contribute to fostering a culture of design excellence within the team.
* Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in UX and AI-driven design.


**The skills you bring:**
* 5+ years of professional experience as a UX Designer, preferably in design agencies or innovative companies.
* A strong portfolio showcasing user-centered design solutions across a range of projects and industries.
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar.
* Experience with AI technologies in the design process (e.g., AI-generated assets, data-driven design) or incorporating AI into user-facing solutions.
* Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, UX research methods, and usability testing.
* Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and communicate design concepts effectively.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation and continuous learning.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


**Plus-to-Have Skills:**
* Experience designing for complex systems, such as enterprise, telecommunication platforms, and B2B services.
* Knowledge of front-end development principles (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to bridge the gap between design and development.
* Familiarity with accessibility standards and inclusive design practices.
* Experience with designing service blueprints for Software-as-a-Service solutions.


**What We Offer:**
* An opportunity to work on impactful, cutting-edge projects in the telecommunications and tech industries.
* Collaboration with a diverse, talented, and innovative team.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment that values creativity and forward-thinking.
* Continuous learning and development opportunities to grow your expertise.


**How to Apply:**
 If you’re passionate about creating exceptional user experiences and leveraging the power of AI to shape the future of design, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Please submit your resume and portfolio showcasing your best work.** 
 Join us at Ericsson and help us design the future! Join us at Ericsson and help us design the future!
   

  

 Last date to apply: October 28th, 2025
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774843

title: CRO internship
description:
**Turn Data into Impact**
 Are you excited by experimentation, user experience, and making data-driven decisions that create real change?
   

  

 At Conversionista!, we’re looking for a CRO Intern who’s eager to explore how insights and design come together to drive measurable business impact. This is your chance to dive deep into experimentation and/or UX - while also getting hands-on experience across different areas of conversion rate optimization.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with some of Nordic’s top CRO experts, take part in real client projects, and help turn data and hypotheses into better digital experiences.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Contribute to the design and execution of A/B tests and experiments
* Support in collecting, structuring, and analyzing data across platforms and channels
* Collaborate with UX designers, analysts, and strategists to create data-driven experiences
* Help prepare reports and insights, turning results into actionable recommendations for clients
* Explore and learn from different expertize within the CRO field - from analytics to UX design to experimentation strategy


**Who We’re Looking For**
 You might be a student in UX design, digital analytics, interaction design, or similar, with a growing curiosity for experimentation and data-driven ways of working. You’re curious about
 *why* 
 users behave the way they do and
 *what happens if we change this button or that flow* 
 .
