title: Senior Informations- och Cybersäkerhetskonsult med affärsområdesansvar
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 I rollen som senior informations- och cybersäkerhetskonsult med affärsområdesansvar kommer du att få en spännande kombination av att både arbeta som konsult i skarpa uppdrag och samtidigt bygga upp samt leda affärsområdet för säkerhet inom Castra Stockholm. Du får alltså det bästa av två världar – operativt arbete och strategiskt ansvar.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer inom offentlig och privat sektor och vara en nyckelperson i Castras fortsatta tillväxt inom säkerhet.
   

  

**I rollen kommer du:**
* Arbeta som konsult i uppdrag inom informations- och/eller cybersäkerhet
* Utföra risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser, stödja vid efterlevnad av standarder som ISO 27001, NIST och CIS
* Rådgiva i säkerhetsfrågor vid digitala transformationer och större IT-projekt
* Bygga upp och leda affärsområdet för informations- och cybersäkerhet i Stockholm
* Sätta strategi, rekrytera konsulter och bygga kundrelationer
* Driva affärer och samarbeta med kollegor från andra affärsområden inom Castra


**Erfarenhet**
* Flera års erfarenhet inom informations- och/eller cybersäkerhet
* Kompetens inom områden som GRC, incidenthantering, säkerhetsarkitektur, riskhantering eller molnsäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av standarder som ISO 27001, NIST, CIS eller liknande ramverk
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga och en naturlig drivkraft att skapa affärer
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen eller vana att arbeta nära kund
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att bygga eller leda affärsområde eller team
* Certifieringar inom säkerhet, t.ex. CISSP, CISM, ISO 27001 Lead Implementer
* Bakgrund inom både teknisk och organisatorisk säkerhet
* Kunskap inom AI Act, DORA med flera.


**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste tre åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även Gasell- och Karriärföretag.
   

  

 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Eskilstuna, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
 Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till semir.jasarevic@castra.se

title: Engineering Manager
description:
*We're at a pivotal moment for both Tibber and the planet. When joining Tibber, you won’t just help scale a forward-thinking tech company – you’ll contribute to a real shift in how people consume electricity. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles, batteries and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique energy trading portfolios on the market.* 




  





*Do you like people, technology and the magic that happens when you put the two together? We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to join us in making the energy transition happen – maybe that’s you?* 




  





**Job Mission 🚀** 




 As an Engineering Manager at Tibber, you will help level up our Commercial Engineering team by applying servant leadership, a customer first perspective and creativity to the problems we are solving together. You will support engineers by being their closest manager, teams by being an active part in their day-to-day work, and our product peers in planning, scoping and executing on new, smart (and pretty damn cool) tech.
 



  





**What You'll Do ✅** 



* **You will be a port of calm for your team** 
 - guiding them through the ups and downs of product development, coach and mentor them in their career and provide them with continuous feedback.
* **Be a partner-in-crime** 
 with stakeholders, product managers and designers, and together with them ensure a healthy backlog, priorities and workload.
* **Build and champion an inclusive, transparent and fun engineering culture.**
* **Work together** 
 with other engineering managers and leaders to ensure sleek but useful ways of working, a healthy tech stack and fair and transparent feedback throughout all stages of the employee lifecycle.



  





**What We're Looking For⚡** 



* **You enjoy technical facilitation and making things happen** 
 - whether it's architectural alignment or even contributing to the solution yourself (code-wise, designing ways of working or something else).
* **You thrive when developing great people** 
 , not just great tech and products.
* **You care about the engineering experience** 
 , agile software practices and conscious experimentation.
* **You have a strong engineering background** 
 and keep yourself familiar with industry trends and product offerings, being able to balance trade-offs between solutions and ways forward. Given the size of the team, you will be expected to contribute with both code and leadership.
* **You are seasoned in stakeholder management** 
 - adapting language and message to context and recipients.
* **You embrace failure as an opportunity for learning and improvement.**



  





**💆🏻 ♀️💆🏽 ♂️The Tibber Mindset** 




 Tibber is not your typical energy supplier. Our tech helps hundreds of thousands of households lower and shift their energy consumption to more sustainable and affordable hours. We’re here to accelerate the energy transition – not in theory, but in everyday life.
 



  





 Being on a mission to change an industry, fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users. We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
 



  





 Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki. We will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
 



  





*Diversity of thought fuels better products, so we welcome applicants of every background, identity and lived experience. Ready to be part of powering the energy transition?* 
***Apply below!***

title: Senior IT säkerhetsarkitekt till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
Som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset har du en nyckelroll i att utveckla och säkra sjukhusets digitala infrastruktur. Du arbetar nära verksamheten och IT-funktionen för att möta ökade krav på säkerhet i takt med digitaliseringens framfart. Rollen är både strategisk och tekniskt djup, med stort fokus på helhetsperspektiv och framtids säkring.
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* En strategiskt viktig roll i ett av Sveriges största och mest komplexa sjukhus
* Möjlighet att påverka och vidareutveckla Karolinskas IT-säkerhetsarkitektur
* Arbete i en organisation med hög säkerhets medvetenhet och starkt fokus på digitalisering
* Samarbete med kompetenta kollegor inom IT, informationssäkerhet och arkitektur
* En variationsrik vardag där du både arbetar operativt och bidrar till långsiktiga lösningar
* Tillgång till ett stort nätverk inom regionen och möjlighet att delta i utvecklingsinitiativ
* En modern arbetsplats med samhällsviktig funktion där ditt arbete gör verklig skillnad


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt blir du en del av ett team bestående av IT-säkerhetsspecialister, informationssäkerhetsspecialister och informationssäkerhetssamordnaren (CISO). I din roll arbetar du brett med IT-säkerhetsfrågor och vidareutvecklar organisationens IT-säkerhetsarkitektur för att stödja digitaliseringen samt möta omvärldens snabba förändringar. Du samarbetar nära Enterprise Arkitekt-teamet, informationssäkerhetssamordnaren, projekt och leverantörer för att säkerställa att information skyddas enligt överenskomna nivåer.
   

  

 Du håller dig kontinuerligt uppdaterad om aktuella hotbilder, arbetsmetoder, teknologier och produkter för att kunna vidareutveckla IT-säkerhetsarkitekturen. Detta inkluderar att skapa en roadmap som stärker och säkerställer IT-säkerhetsförmågan både i on-premise-miljöer och i molnet.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter omfattar bland annat att designa och implementera säkerhetsarkitekturer för att skydda system och data, samtidigt som du förvaltar och vidareutvecklar IT-säkerhetsarkitekturen för hela organisationen. Du deltar aktivt i design- och implementeringsarbetet av IT-säkerhetsarkitekturen. Genom att utvärdera och välja lämpliga tekniska lösningar och verktyg håller du dig ständigt uppdaterad om nya tekniktrender och säkerställer att nya och förändrade IT-lösningar uppfyller säkerhetskraven. En viktig del i ditt arbete är att genomföra riskbedömningar och hotmodellering.
   

  

 Du samverkar också med verksamheten för att förstå deras behov och identifiera potentiella säkerhetsrisker. I rollen ingår att stödja projekt och produktområden med säkerhetskrav, vägledning och arkitektur, samt att delta i design och implementation av säkerhetslösningar där du leder kraven inom säkerhetsarkitektur. Du arbetar nära tvärfunktionella team och projekt för att säkerställa att IT-säkerhetsarkitekturen integreras på rätt sätt.
   

  

 Vidare ansvarar du för att ta fram, förvalta och revidera styrdokument inom IT-säkerhet. Du bidrar till att säkerställa att strategi, styrande principer och riktlinjer för IT-säkerhetsarkitektur efterlevs och kontinuerligt utvecklas. Ditt arbete innebär även aktivt deltagande i sjukhusets EA-gruppering. Du har god kunskap om gällande standarder och ramverk, såsom CIS, NIS/NIS2, NIST, ISO 27000 samt AI-förordningen.
   

  

 Utbildning och kunskapsdelning är också en central del av din roll, där du leder och genomför utbildningar samt workshops inom arkitekturområdet. Du granskar remisser och säkerhetsarbete och stöttar team och andra arkitekter med kompetensutveckling och arbetssätt inom området.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* Motiveras av komplexa utmaningar
* Har förmåga att kommunicera säkerhetsrelaterade frågor på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt, och kan arbeta mot uppsatta mål med förväntat resultat
* Har en god analytisk förmåga och ett strategiskt tankesätt som gör att du självständigt och med initiativförmåga kan driva komplexa projekt framåt
* Planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt
* Är ansvarsfull, noggrann och strukturerad, med god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga
* Har lätt för att skapa förtroende, uppskattar teamarbete och har förmåga att bygga goda relationer
* Håller dig uppdaterad om aktuella hot och risker inom IT-säkerhet
* Har god förmåga att kommunicera på svenska i både tal och skrift


 Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Högskoleexamen inom relevant område för rollen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Flera års erfarenhet som IT-säkerhetsarkitektur i komplexa miljöer bestående av transaktions intensiva system med höga säkerhetskrav
* Kunskap om moln lösningar och deras säkerhetsfunktioner
* Djupa kunskaper i säkerhetsarkitektur kring IAM / IDP lösningar i komplexa miljöer.
* Certifierad inom IT-säkerhet/arkitektur
* God erfarenhet av säkerhet inom olika typer av federerings plattformar
* Erfarenhet av riskhantering, sårbarhets hantering, kontinuitetsplanering och kravställning mot leverantörer.
* Djupa kunskaper inom design av IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, kryptering, åtkomst/behörighetshantering, applikationsdrift och operativsystem


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete vid myndighet, offentlig sektor eller global verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av ackreditering för säkerhetsskyddsklassade informationssystem


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Data Engineer – PySpark & Cloud Workflows
company_industry: Information Technology & Services, IT System Custom Software Development, and Software Development
description:
Company: US3 Consulting
 



 About Company: US3 Consulting is a leading European IT recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top tech talent with innovative companies across the continent. With decades of experience and a fresh approach, we specialize in rapid, cost-effective candidate sourcing across all tech industry sectors. Our expert consultants are committed to building strong, productive relationships, ensuring the perfect fit between candidates and employers.
 



  





 Job Title: Data Engineer – PySpark & Cloud Workflows
 



 Total Experience Required: 6+ years in Information Technology/Computers/Software
 



 Relevant Experience Required: 4+ years in data engineering and analytics, with hands-on experience in Python, PySpark, and workflow orchestration tools.
 



 Job Type: Contract
 



 Contract Duration: A minimum duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to 18 months or beyond, depending on project requirements.
 



 Workplace Type: Hybrid (at least 3 times a week at office)
 



 Languages Required: English, Swedish is a plus
 



 Visa/Work Authorization Status: Candidates must hold a valid work permit or visa to work in Sweden
 



 Work Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 


1. Must be currently based in Sweden or
2. Willing to relocate to Sweden from anywhere within Europe or the UK
3. Candidates outside Europe/UK unfortunately cannot be considered



  





 About Client: Client offers a dynamic environment where innovation and professional growth are at the forefront. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning, the company provides employees access to extensive training programs, including LinkedIn Learning and an Education Assistance Program.
 



 The company champions a balanced work-life culture, promoting flexible work hours and a supportive atmosphere that values diversity and inclusion. As a part of the esteemed group, it combines global opportunities with a commitment to employee well-being, making it an ideal workplace for those seeking both professional excellence and personal fulfillment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and maintain data pipelines using PySpark, Python, and Apache Airflow.
* Design, implement, and optimise data models and ETL workflows.
* Perform SQL development and query tuning for efficient data retrieval.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support analytics and data-driven projects.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Strong experience with Python, PySpark, Apache Airflow, and Scala.
* Proficient in SQL with experience in query optimisation.
* Exposure to DBT (Data Build Tool) is an advantage.



  





**Optional Skills:** 



* Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms or advanced analytics frameworks.
* Experience in large-scale data engineering projects.



  





 Interested? Apply Now!
 



 📧 Send your resume to: sowmya@us3consulting.nl
 







 🔁 Not a fit for you? Share this with someone in your network who might be interested!
 



 🔗 Connect: linkedin.com/in/sowmyakotamarthy
 



 🌐 Visit our homepage: https://www.us3consulting.co.uk
 



 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn for more exciting opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/company/us3-consulting
 



  





 #DataEngineering #PySpark #Python #ApacheAirflow #Scala #SQL #DBT #ETL #DataPipelines #ContractRole #Stockholm

title: Vendor Manager
description:
Lendo Group is at a pivotal moment. As we prepare for a carve-out from our parent company, Vend, we need to build our own operational foundation, which includes establishing direct relationships with key service providers. We are looking for a skilled
 **Vendor Manager** 
 to lead this effort, specifically for our IT, HR, and Finance functions.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to build and own our vendor ecosystem. Reporting to the Head of IT Security & Governance, you will not only be responsible for procurement and performance but also for ensuring our third-party relationships are secure, compliant, and robust.
   

  

***This position can be located in Stockholm or Oslo.***
**What You'll Do**
* Lead the Sourcing and Procurement Process: Identify, evaluate, and select new vendors for core IT, HR, and Finance services, with a strong focus on security, compliance, and risk.
* Conduct Security & Compliance Due Diligence: Perform initial security assessments and ongoing monitoring of vendors to ensure they meet Lendo Group's security and regulatory requirements.
* Negotiate and Manage Contracts: Finalize vendor agreements, ensuring that contracts include strong security clauses, service level agreements (SLAs), and clear termination rights.
* Oversee Implementation: Manage the onboarding and integration of new vendor services, coordinating with internal teams to ensure a smooth transition from our parent company.
* Manage Vendor Performance & Risk: Proactively monitor vendor performance and security posture. Conduct regular business reviews and risk assessments to ensure continuous adherence to our standards.
* Build Relationships: Act as the primary point of contact for external partners, fostering strong, collaborative relationships while ensuring accountability.

title: Operations Manager
description:
At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product market fit, trusted by global leaders like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin and Bird & Bird. Backed by over $110M in funding from top investors including ICONIQ, General Catalyst, Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, Slack, and top tier consulting and law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

**The Role**
 Legora’s Operations team sits at the heart of the company, making sure everything runs, scales, and evolves at the same incredible pace as our product and clients. We’re now looking for an Operations Associate to join this small but mighty team and accelerate our global growth.
   

  

 This is the perfect role for someone who thrives in a fast-moving environment, wants to help shape how a company operates, and enjoys working cross functionally to make big things happen. You’ll work closely with our leadership team on a wide range of projects across operations, GTM, legal, product, and recruiting, helping the company stay one step ahead as we scale.
   

  

 Think of it as part operator, part project manager, part Chief of Staff. A role where you’ll take ownership, bring structure to complexity, and have an outsized impact on how the company runs day to day.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Work cross-functionally** 
 with operations, GTM, legal, management, and engineering on a wide variety of strategic and operational projects.
   

  

**Translate priorities into execution** 
 - breaking down goals, tracking progress, and keeping the organisation moving fast and aligned.
   

  

**Take ownership** 
 of company wide initiatives, ensuring clarity, follow-up, and results.
   

  

**Identify and fix bottlenecks** 
 - spotting operational challenges before they become problems.
   

  

**Help build systems and processes** 
 that enable scale, without slowing the team down.
   

  

**Play a key role in shaping the company** 
 as it grows, contributing to decisions that define how we work, communicate, and operate.
   

  

**Be challenged and grow quickly** 
 - this is a role with steep learning curves and real impact.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**Innovative:** 
 You thrive in a dynamic startup environment where problems don’t always have obvious or easy answers.
   

  

**Autonomous:** 
 You take initiative, lead with ownership, and value feedback, you’d rather move fast and learn than play it safe. You’re getting things done.
   

  

**Entrepreneurial:** 
 You’re energized by building, not maintaining — and you’re comfortable adapting as responsibilities evolve.
   

  

**Collaborative:** 
 You enjoy working with others and believe that great outcomes are built together.
   

  

**Structured:** 
 You bring clarity to ambiguity and know how to turn messy problems into actionable plans.
   

  

**No Ego:** 
 We put the company first. We take pride in delivering outcomes, sometimes this means getting your hands dirty.
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* 2–4 years of experience in MBB, operations, business management, or a fast growing startup.
* Proven ability to lead and execute complex, cross-functional projects.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (Swedish a plus).
* Experience working directly with senior leaders or founders.


**Why This Role Matters**
 This is a chance to help build the engine behind one of the most exciting companies in legal tech. You’ll work on high leverage projects, collaborate closely with leadership, and play a key role in shaping how Legora scales globally.
   

  

 If you’re excited by the idea of combining strategy, operations, and execution, and want to be part of a world class team redefining an industry. We’d love to meet you.
   

  

 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Growth Director (EMEA)
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.
   

  

 Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.
   

  

 We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.
   

  

 Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.
   

  

 Your mission when joining Einride as a Director, Growth (EMEA) will be to drive profitable growth across our most strategic accounts in the region. This is a crucial, high-impact role where you will partner closely with Business Unit Commercial Leads and Operational Account Managers to ensure customer success and identify new business opportunities.
   

  

 This role is perfect for someone who combines two key strengths:
   

  

* The ability to build strong relationships and communicate with and sell effectively to customers.
* A highly analytical, data-driven, and process-oriented mindset with strong problem-solving skills, organization, and follow-through.


**You Will**
**Customer Success & Deliverables**
* Serve as the day-to-day key point of contact for strategic accounts, supporting Commercial and Operational Leads to ensure customer satisfaction and value realization.
* Monitor KPIs to ensure customers achieve their operational and sustainability objectives.
* Develop Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) and customer success reporting, highlighting progress against KPIs.
* Project manage cross-functional teams to ensure commitments made to customers are delivered with quality and timeliness.
* Translate customer goals into internal actions across operations, charging, product, and finance.


**Strategic Growth & Performance Analytics**
* Develop account growth plans in collaboration with Commercial and Operational Leads and facilitate related discussions with customers.
* Analyze customer data and operational reports to uncover new business opportunities across various Einride Business Units and develop supporting business cases.
* Coordinate pilots and innovation initiatives with customers.
* Monitor account performance and proactively identify improvement opportunities or risks.
* Partner with Business Control and Finance to ensure account profitability and margin health.


**Stakeholder Management & Continuous Improvement**
* Build and maintain a stakeholder map and engagement plan, identifying relationship gaps or risk areas and developing mitigation plans.
* Capture customer feedback and route it effectively to Product and Operations, ensuring prioritization and visibility for critical needs.


**AI & Automation**
* Apply AI tools to automate and streamline the above processes, improving speed, accuracy, scalability, and simplicity.


**We Expect You To**
* Hold a Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in a technical field such as Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, Business, or equivalent experience.
* Bring 8–10 years of experience in account management, business development, customer success, management consulting, or other roles that combine analytical and customer-facing skills, preferably in transportation and freight logistics.
* Possess expertise in key BI and technical tools, including Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Google Slides, Looker/Looker Studio, BigQuery, or similar platforms.
* Demonstrate the ability to use AI tools to work faster and smarter, increasing efficiency and quality.
* Exhibit strong business acumen with a deep understanding of how to manage and improve P&L (Profit and Loss).
* Have a strong sales mindset and storytelling capability, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives that drive client adoption.
* Possess industry knowledge and experience in freight, logistics, EVs, and/or supply chain.


 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Portfolio & Product Performance Lead
description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.
   

  

 We're looking for a
 **Portfolio & Product Performance Lead** 
 to join our team in Espoo or Stockholm! You'll be at the heart of our portfolio management, driving a market-centric and data-informed approach to how we craft joy for millions of players. You'll report to the SVP Portfolio & Player Excellence, helping leaders make informed investment choices and empowering our game teams with insights that truly make a difference.
   

  

 You will have impact and fun at work by:
   

  

* Leading and evolving our Flightpath governance and Game reviews, ensuring clarity and consistent standards across our portfolio.
* Delivering a 360° view of performance, including financials, game, player and community health, and market signals, both at game and portfolio level
* Collaborating with various stakeholders (e.g. BI, Finance, User Experience Research, Tech, Studios) to define strategic needs and focus on high-impact questions. Building a unified portfolio narrative.
* Supporting game teams in preparing for game reviews, providing actionable insights, and coaching them to balance governance with product vision.
* Establishing automated monitoring systems to track mobile market trends, competitor performance, and player behavior, leveraging AI for strategic opportunities.


 Experience and skills we are looking for:
   

  

* You have preferably 7+ years of experience in portfolio management, product strategy, business intelligence, or market analysis, ideally within the gaming, tech, or entertainment industry.
* You've consistently delivered integrated performance insights that combine financial, product, player, and market perspectives.
* You're experienced in supporting both executive decision forums and product-level decision-making.
* You have a degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
* You possess exceptional analytical, quantitative, and strategic problem-solving skills, able to synthesize complex data into actionable insights.
* You're an expert in financial modeling, forecasting, and KPI framework development.
* You’re a strong facilitator and communicator, trusted by both senior leaders and product teams.
* You’re curious about testing various games, understanding the industry and its products better.


 It would be nice if you also have the following skills:
   

  

* Expertise in the free-to-play mobile gaming business models.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams or initiatives.


 Please send your CV in English. We look forward to speaking to you!
   

  

 We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.
   

  

 At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or conditions in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.
   

  

**What to expect when you join us**
**Meet the Rovians**
**Hiring process at Rovio**
**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio**

title: Backend Developer - Integrations Department
company_industry: Software Development and Human Resources Services
description:
**About Hailey 🐦** 




 In the spring of 2020 Hailey HR was founded. We're a tech start up that want to digitalise, simplify and modernise the HR industry with our HR-SaaS – join us on our journey!
 



  





**About the position 💼** 




 We are establishing a new department at Hailey dedicated to integrations. This team will focus on enhancing our existing standard integrations, developing new ones, and supporting customers with tailored solutions. Previously part of our Development department, this new structure allows us to give integrations the specialized attention they deserve, which ensures greater continuity, an agile process suited for building integrations, and an even better experience for our customers.
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who values automation and understands the benefits of automated CI/CD pipelines for building, testing, code analysis, and deployment. You enjoy being involved in backend requirements gathering and have a strong interest in understanding customer needs.
 



  





 As a member of this newly established team, you will collaborate closely with the Integration department manager, two backend developers, and a QA engineer. Together, you will define the team’s ways of working and shape the technical direction for integration development at Hailey. This is a unique opportunity to influence both the culture and the architecture of a growing function, while collaborating with customers, product department, customer success, and other development teams to deliver great integration experiences.
 



  





 Our integration services are built using .NET Core and modern frameworks, following contemporary design patterns with a strong emphasis on quality, maintainability, and scalability. Our services are built in .NET Core using modern frameworks and design patterns, with a strong focus on quality and maintainability.
 



  





 With us, there are a lot of opportunities to learn and grow, and you will quickly be able to take significant ownership of your daily work. We appreciate if you value quality and are committed to your own and the company's development.
 



  





**What are we looking for?** 



* Post secondary education in relevant area.
* Minimum 1 years of backend development experience.
* Interest in working with integrations.
* Full professional fluency in Swedish and great English skills (speech and writing).



  





**We believe you are:** 



* Flexible and thrives in an innovative and dynamic environment, where solutions are always open to discussion.
* Enjoy working in a team, pair programming, and see the value of code reviews because you work closely with your colleagues in the team.
* Loving table tennis! (or at least find it okay, it’s a part of our culture after all 🏓)



  





**What you will learn or might already know:** 




 .Net Core, REST, OIDC, OAuth 2.0, salary processes, EntraId/AD, Event sourcing, CQRS, AMQP, Layered architecture, AAA-patterns for unit testing, Scripted CI/CD-pipelines.
 



 💡 It's perfectly fine if you are not familiar with the frameworks and patterns used, we are more interested in your mindset and willingness to learn.
 



  





**More information** 




**Process:** 




 The application deadline is November 30, but the position may close earlier, so make sure to apply right away! 🤝
 



**Scope:** 
 100%
 



**Start:** 
 Q1 2026
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (on-site)
 



  





 We’re looking forward to your application! 👋 💌

title: Administratör inom energisektorn
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **6+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Roll och ansvar:**
 Uppdraget omfattar att vara administratör/assistent åt ett antal avdelnings-, sektions- och enhetschefer. Rollen kommer att delas mellan flera olika enheter/sektioner på avdelning NIK.
   

  

 Avdelningsadministratören behöver självständigt och med stort eget ansvar tillsammans med cheferna arbeta för att avlasta dem i sitt dagliga arbete genom att planera och utföra administrativa uppgifter.
   

  

**I uppdraget ingår följande arbetsuppgifter:**
 I arbetsuppgifterna ingår bl.a. att avlasta enhetschefer i administrativa göromål, såsom:
   

  

* Dokumentation, uppföljning och rapportering av enheternas verksamhet
* Mötes- och konferensbokningar samt resebokningar
* Avdelningens intranätsredaktör
* Utbildningssamordning
* Planering av möten och workshops
* Samordning mellan enheter och avdelningar
* Protokollskrivning
* Fakturahantering


**Skallkrav**
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som administrativt stöd åt chefer i offentlig verksamhet, tex statlig eller kommunal.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som administrativt stöd åt chefer i ledningsgrupp inom energi- och eller elmarknad.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom till exempel ekonomi, HR eller administration alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Mycket god förmåga i kommunikation i tal och skrift på Svenska och Engelska


**Börkrav**
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom energi- och eller elmarknad.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbetat i ekonomisystemet UBW/Agresso.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att dokumentera styrgruppsmöten eller liknande beslutande verksamhet.


**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Teknikspecialist för nytt avvikelsehanteringssystem
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla verksamheter inom Region Stockholm och Region Gotland? Vi bygger nu ett team som ska leda arbetet med vårt nya regionsgemensamma systemstöd för avvikelsehantering och förbättringsarbete.
   

  

 Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt engagerade team!
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* ett viktigt uppdrag i en verksamhet med höga kvalitetskrav och samhällsnytta
* att vara en nyckelperson i utvecklingen och förvaltningen av ett strategiskt viktigt system för Region Stockholm och Region Gotland
* möjligheten att påverka och förbättra processer som skapar tryggare och mer effektiva verksamheter
* ett arbete i en dynamisk och utvecklingsinriktad organisation med starkt regionalt samarbete.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset har uppdrag att förvalta och utveckla Region Stockholms och Region Gotlands nya gemensamma systemstöd för avvikelser (exempelvis avvikelser inom vård, arbetsmiljö, miljö, laboratorieverksamhet och omvårdnad). Systemstödet hanterar även patienters/medborgares synpunkter och förbättringsförslag.
   

  

 Arbete pågår nu med att förbereda införandet av vårt nya systemstöd och att etablera förvaltningsorganisationen. Som teknikspecialist deltar du i införandet av systemet och leder det tekniska förvaltningsarbetet. Du ansvarar för att säkerställa en tekniskt stabil och säker produkt, samarbetar nära med leverantörer och är sakkunnig inom förvaltningsområdets teknik.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Bland Annat**
* stödja lokala förvaltningar i frågor som rör funktionalitet, konfiguration och teknik
* samarbeta nära leverantörer och fungera som teknisk kravställare för att säkerställa att systemet uppfyller verksamhetens behov
* leda förändringar och tekniska arbeten samt ta fram beslutsunderlag i olika tekniska vägval och inför strategiska beslut
* säkerställa en säker och stabil produkt genom säkerhetskontroller, incidenthantering och genomförande av problemutredningar för att minimera driftstörningar
* konfigurera och vidareutveckla systemets funktionalitet för att maximera nyttan av tillgängliga funktioner.


**Vi söker dig som**
* har djup förståelse för förvaltningsområdets tekniska miljö och förmågan att realisera tekniska krav utifrån verksamhetens behov
* har en passion för teknik och vill både utföra tekniska uppgifter och stödja andra
* har god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs i samarbete med både teknik- och verksamhetsrepresentanter
* har ett starkt driv genom att du ser vad som behöver göras och driver det framåt, även i en föränderlig miljö
* är strukturerad, noggrann och tar stort ansvar för hög kvalitet på din leverans.


**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, informationsteknik. Alternativt annan utbildning/arbetserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med teknisk förvaltning, systemintegration och konfiguration
* God förmåga att utrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av IT-stöd inom avvikelsehantering eller ärendehantering, särskilt meriterande med erfarenhet från iFacts, Marval MSM eller ServiceNow
* Erfarenhet av support- och förvaltningsarbete enligt ITIL eller liknande ramverk
* God förståelse för relevanta standarder och regelverk som exempelvis Patientsäkerhetslagen, Patientdatalagen, GDPR, Arbetsmiljölagen och AFS
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-miljö inom offentlig verksamhet, särskilt meriterande med erfarenhet från inom hälso- och sjukvård eller Region Stockholm.


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Fackliga representanter

title: Systems Expert
description:
**Join Vattenfall as a** 
**Systems Expert** 
**. Here, you will shape our cutting-edge maintenance frameworks, optimize risk-based strategies, and unite global teams across onshore and offshore sites. Leveraging our SAP tools you’ll deliver innovative solutions that keep our turbines running at peak performance – all while contributing to our mission of fossil-free living.**
 You will join BU Offshore Generation in the Supply Chain and Maintenance Systems Department, specifically under Maintenance Systems Improvement team. As part of Maintenance Systems Improvement team, we focus on optimizing operational processes through SAP service execution, supporting both onshore and offshore wind operations. In this international environment, you’ll collaborate across multiple locations—Stockholm, Amsterdam, London, Berlin, Kolding—to harmonize system solutions and ensure seamless end-to-end processes for our wind operations.
   

  

**Be in your element with BA Wind**
 As part of BA Wind you will play a key role in one of the most exciting pipelines in the industry with 24GW of capacity stretching out more than a decade ahead across our key European markets.
   

  

 You won’t only be involved in developing projects but pioneering cutting-edge innovation, new business models and ways of working with communities and the environment. Working as part of a leading European utility also means you could be helping a growing number of major businesses and brands achieve their own sustainability goals through partnerships.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Your role**
 As the Systems Expert, you will be the central authority on designing, deploying, and optimizing maintenance system solutions – primarily around SAP PM (Plant Maintenance) and MM (Materials Management) – for our onshore and offshore wind operations. In this multifaceted position, you will simultaneously act as a System Project Manager, Lead Key User, Portfolio Manager, and Implementation Advisor, ensuring that maintenance systems projects are executed on time, within scope, and with full alignment among diverse stakeholders. Working closely with the Business Demand Manager, you will help chart the strategic direction for Maintenance Systems, driving continuous improvement and fostering collaboration across functions such as IT, Supply Chain, Operations/Site teams, Integrated Operations, Engineering and Finance. Your responsibilities will include owning solutions for the maintenance systems of wind (PM/MM), defining project and systems solution roadmaps, representing user needs in system configurations, shaping and prioritizing the development portfolio, and guiding the adoption of best practices. By translating technical insights into clear project requirements and bridging the gap between operations and technology, you will play a pivotal role in scaling our processes, reinforcing data-driven decision-making, and enhancing the overall effectiveness of our maintenance solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Project Management** 
 :
   

  

* Set up project teams, define plans, conduct stakeholder/risk analyses, and manage projects within Maintenance Systems.
* Coordinate readiness reviews, cutover plans, and go-live support, ensuring a smooth transition to production.


**Maintenance Systems Authority**
* Own system solutions for the maintenance systems of wind (PM/MM)
* Serve as the Lead Key User for the SAP solution in BA Wind (service execution & supply chain).
* Advise project teams on maintenance systems setup, spearheading business assessments and initiating change requests when needed.


**Portfolio & Stakeholder Alignment**
* Collaborate with the Business Demand Manager to develop and prioritize the portfolio of improvements in Wind Maintenance Systems.
* Engage with IT, Integrated Operations, Finance, Engineering, and site teams to gather requirements and address challenges.


**Implementation & Continuous Improvement**
* Identify potential issues, propose solutions, and recommend process changes based on project analyses.
* Document lessons learned and refine existing workflows to align with organizational standards.


**Agile Sprint Management**
* Drive detailed sprint planning, ensuring an iterative approach to enhancements in SAP functionality.
* Work closely with IT to manage development backlogs and integrate feedback across multiple stakeholders.


**Your profile**
 You are a driven professional who effortlessly combines an in-depth understanding of SAP PM and MM with a strategic, forward-thinking approach to project delivery. You enjoy transforming complex operational needs into streamlined solutions, and you excel at building collaborative relationships across diverse teams—from Finance and Engineering to site personnel and IT. With an agile mindset and solid portfolio management skills, you confidently prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment while remaining attentive to details. You approach challenges with curiosity and innovation, ensuring that key stakeholders are not just aligned but fully engaged in the process. Fluent in English, you are adept at communicating technical insights clearly, motivating others through your structured problem-solving, and delivering tangible results that optimize both onshore and offshore wind operations. Above all, you thrive in a setting where you can leverage your expertise to shape and elevate maintenance systems for the future of renewable energy.
   

  

**Educational Background**
 Next to this, you bring:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Engineering or a scientific discipline).


**Industry & Technical Expertise**
* At least 5 years of experience in a similar position, with proven know-how in wind O&M daily operations.
* Expert user of SAP PM/MM modules, capable of guiding implementation and troubleshooting.


**Project & Portfolio Management**
* Demonstrated success driving complex projects and managing stakeholder expectations in an international setting.
* Agile-minded, skilled in sprint management and iterative solution development.


**Soft Skills**
* High proficiency in English (written and spoken); additional language skills (e.g., Danish, German) are a plus.
* Strong problem-solving capabilities and ability to build trust-based relationships with cross-functional teams.
* Structured approach to tasks, with excellent communication skills for guiding varied stakeholders.


**Why not start your journey to working for fossil freedom by applying now?**
**Location** 
 Kolding, Denmark – London, United Kingdom – Amsterdam, Netherlands – Solna/Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Our offer**
**Looking for a career with growth?**
 Looking for a role where your superpowers can be leveraged to the maximum and with limitless opportunities for growth?
   

  

 The scale and ambition of our wind, battery and solar business means you can really find your element with us. We’ll also provide you with all the learning and development you need to expand your horizons.
   

  

 We strive to be the best place to work in the industry with highly competitive pay and conditions and an open, supportive culture. A commitment to a healthy work-life balance aims to ensure everyone plays to their strengths, whatever their background and experiences.
   

  

 You will be part of a growing team of 1,700+ colleagues from 50+ nationalities where our positive approach to diversity is reflected in the fact that more than a quarter of staff are women.
   

  

**More Information**
 For more information about the position, you are welcome to contact hiring manager Joyce Tibangay Westi, joycetibangay.westi@vattenfall.com. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our recruiter Christian Pathuel, christian.pathuel@vattenfall.com
   

  

 We welcome your application in English no later than 12.10.2025. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to building a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfil within Vattenfall and will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classified the final candidates might be subject to a security vetting process, according to Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a leading European energy company driving the transition to a sustainable energy system. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We employ around 21 000 people mostly in our core markets in Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK.

title: Senior Partner Engineer - Experience
description:
We’re looking for a Senior Partner Engineer to join one of our teams that owns partner integrations with major platforms. In this role, you will collaborate with stakeholders, both internal and external, to drive integrations, resolve technical issues, and enhance the overall Spotify experience.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you will become an expert in our partner integrations: a diverse range of APIs and SDKs.
   

  

 You will collaborate with partners all around the world, and work with them to integrate the Spotify experience into their platforms and surfaces; or understand their requirements and translate them into actionable work for our engineering teams.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Drive partner-specific projects where we will enable the Spotify experience for millions of users around the world.
* Drive a holistic approach to partner management and related processes by owning the partner journey and driving improvement initiatives.
* Develop effective communication strategies based on partner and Spotify needs, and work within a community of Partner Engineers to continuously improve standards, strategies, and frameworks.
* Unblock internal and external teams by figuring out dependencies, assessing technical risks, and clarifying uncertainty.
* Ensure that our partner solutions are reusable and take into account larger strategic concerns.
* Ensure that the Spotify experience we ship with our partners is of high quality and continuously improves.
* Ensure testing and bug reporting practices are robust, including automated tests to maintain quality and efficiency.
* Mentor and coach less experienced Partner Engineers.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You’ve worked closely with partners, customers, vendors, etc. and are an excellent communicator across different cultures and different domains (product, business, engineering, design, etc.)
* You have experience working in Software Engineering in an agile environment. You understand and can explain our diverse APIs, SDKs and systems.
* You have experience in programming languages, preferably Kotlin, Swift of Java, in a professional setting.
* You can recognize operational processes that need improvement, and you have the drive to improve them.
* You are comfortable with flexible working hours to accommodate video calls in different time zones.
* You are able to travel on occasion to visit partners.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Administrativt stöd till expansiv samhällsaktör inom energiområdet
description:
Vi söker en erfaren administratör eller assistent för ett varierande uppdrag hos en samhällsviktig aktör i tillväxt.
   

  

 Organisationen expanderar snabbt och behöver stärka sina chefer med ett självgående administrativt stöd.
   

  

 Möjlighet för dig som trivs med många kontaktytor, struktur och att bidra till effektivitet i ledningens vardag.
   

  

 Om rollen:
   

  

* Administrativt stöd till flera chefer på avdelnings-, sektions- och enhetsnivå.
* Planering, dokumentation och uppföljning av verksamheten.
* Boka möten, konferenser och resor.
* Samordning mellan enheter och avdelningar.
* Protokollskrivning och rapportering.
* Fakturahantering och enklare ekonomiadministration.
* Intranätsredaktör för avdelningen.
* Samordna utbildningar, workshops och interna möten.
* Möjlighet att driva egna administrativa projekt i samråd med chefer.


 Din profil:
   

  

* Självgående, strukturerad och serviceinriktad.
* God samarbetsförmåga och kommunikativ förmåga.
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av administrativt stöd till chefer inom offentlig verksamhet.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av stöd till chefer i ledningsgrupp inom energi- eller elmarknaden.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom ekonomi, HR eller administration alternativt motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Mycket god förmåga i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift.


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från energi- eller elmarknaden.
* Erfarenhet av ekonomisystemet UBW eller Agresso.
* Erfarenhet av dokumentation från styrgruppsmöten eller beslutande forum.


 Uppdragets omfattning:
   

  

* Konsultuppdrag på heltid i Mälardalsområdet.
* Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med chefer och verksamhetsledning.


 Vem trivs här:
   

  

* Du som gillar ordning, kommunikation och samarbete.
* Du som tar initiativ och bidrar till smidiga processer i en organisation med högt tempo.


 Vill du bidra till framtidens energiinfrastruktur? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – urval sker löpande.

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We, in the infrastructure team,** 
 empower Android engineering teams to build products efficiently and reliably.
   

  

**As a Senior Android Engineer** 
 , you will play a key role in the
 **Infrastructure team** 
 by improving developer experience, building and maintaining internal tools, ensuring CI/CD stability and efficiency, and guiding app architecture. You will collaborate directly with backend and data infrastructure teams to build and enhance engineering platforms. As this role is primarily infrastructure-focused, your work will center around internal systems and tooling, rather than UI development or feature delivery within the app.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Collaborate with other developers, data analysts, and release managers to design, buil,d and maintain robust infrastructure and tooling that boosts the productivity of our Android engineering teams.
* Take full ownership of the Android developer experience, continuously evolving it by building and maintaining internal libraries, Gradle plugins, and optimizing our CI/CD pipelines.
* Develop automation solutions that eliminate repetitive manual tasks for developers, freeing them to focus on feature development.
* Identify & execute large tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
* Set and maintain high engineering standards, ensuring infrastructure consistently meets developer needs.
* Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* 5+ years of experience in Android development.
* Strong passion for enhancing the developer experience, building internal tooling, and reducing developer friction.
* Ability to work independently, proactively identify problems, and autonomously drive your own work from conception to completion. You are expected to be a self-starter and take initiative.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to diagnose complex technical issues, and propose effective solutions.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Excellent communication skills in English.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Experience with build and CI/CD systems, particularly Gradle and GitHub Actions.
* Experience with building Gradle plugins.
* Experience with building internal tools.
* Experience in investigating ANRs and analyzing bug reports. Analytical skills for finding root causes of crashes and other critical issues.
* Experience in debugging and profiling Android applications.
* Experience presenting on technical topics or advocating for best practices within an engineering organization.


**Life at Truecaller** 
 - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
   

  

**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. We are excited to hear from you, don’t hesitate to apply!
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 We only accept applications in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We in the Messaging team** 
 own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.
   

  

**As a Senior Android Engineer within the messaging team,** 
 you will play a key role in building and enhancing core messaging features integral to our product. You'll work closely with a talented team of Android engineers, writing high-quality, maintainable code while ensuring optimal performance and user experience. Collaboration is at the heart of this role, as you'll partner with various teams and roles across the company to align with shared objectives and contribute to the broader product vision. By following best practices and upholding high engineering standards, you'll help drive the success of our platform, making a meaningful impact while growing in a dynamic and supportive environment.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, designers, and engineers to build & A/B test new features using Agile methodology.
* Identify & execute large tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
* Take responsibility for setting & maintaining high engineering standards and commitment to building products that meet user needs.
* Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* 8+ years of experience in Android development.
* A strong passion for enhancing user experiences and contributing to product roadmap.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Experience with RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Strong knowledge of version control tools, such as Git.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices, as well as an eye for design.
* Interest in mentoring & coaching others.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!
* Relocation: Ready for a new adventure in Stockholm? We've got you covered! Our comprehensive relocation support package is designed for a seamless transition. We'll assist with your visa and work permits, cover your airfare, help you find a new home, and provide settling-in services to navigate everything from setting up a bank account to registering with local authorities.

 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products.
