title: Head of Customer Acquisition
description:
**Job ID:  28832**
 We are looking for a Nordic Head of Customer Acquisition to lead and drive the customer acquisition team and activities in Business Banking Digital Sales and Engagement unit. This is a full-time and permanent position.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Welcome to Digital Sales and Engagement team in Business Banking. We grow and nurture the Small Business & Entrepreneurs customer segment with customer acquisition, and high-quality customer engagement programs in our digital sales channels and platforms. Our objective is to grow the SB&E segment, to boost customer satisfaction, and to increase the share of digital sales, driving channel transition. As the Nordic Head of Customer Acquisition, you’ll play a key role in achieving these targets. You lead the Nordic team of digital sales & marketing professionals, and will be working closely together with the entire team. You will also collaborate with various stakeholders in Business Banking, all contributing to the common goal of driving growth.
   

  

 You as the leader, play a key role in developing and supporting your team members to reach their aspirations and unleash their full potential.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Lead the Nordic digital customer acquisition team, and create a work environment built on trust, collaboration and good communication
* Drive SB&E segment growth for all Nordic countries by introducing customer acquisition strategies tailored to the customer segment behaviour and Nordea digital channels
* Create new ways of working and processes to support the new strategic growth areas, demonstrate willingness and flexibility to experiment to find new best practices for the team
* Collaborate closely across different teams in Digital Sales and Engagement unit, and other key stakeholders such as Business Banking country customer responsible units and group marketing
* Support and coach the entire Digital Sales and Engagement team on growth marketing, customer acquisition techniques and paid media best practices
* Analyse and optimize the chosen customer acquisition activities constantly to improve conversion rate and return on marketing investment
* Develop multi-channel acquisition programs utilising for example paid search, paid social, display, OLV
* Be comfortable with legal questions related to data and it's usage, in a regulated B2B and Banking environment


**Who You Are**
**This is the right role for you if you are/have:**
* Capacity to work and lead under pressure and have strong analytical skills combined with a business-oriented mind-set and an excellent communication skills
* Practice empowering leadership and have excellent collaborative skills, with a passion for developing new ways of working
* Willing to show enthusiasm, open-mindedness, drive and determination
* A “Doer” that thrives in a complex environment, generating ideas, solving problems and communicating ideas and decisions effectively to team members and stakeholders


**Your background and skills include:**
* Proven track record in leading growth with new customer acquisition in digital environment, driving tangible results in business growth while maintaining good customer experience, profitability and brand image
* Experience in commercial and team leadership, supporting the team and developing new processes and ways of working for digital customer acquisition
* Experience in achieving results through people and leading a team with senior and experienced experts, with high integrity and empowering leadership style
* Demonstrated understanding of customer needs and utilization of commercial insight data for business value generation
* Excellent collaboration skills, ability to work for the common objectives and priorities while driving own area to success
* Fluency in both written and spoken English
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in business, marketing or related field. Equivalent years of working experience will be considered in lieu of a degree


**As the Leader, you are expected to and have a crucial role in:**
* Creating purpose by translating strategy into operational and actionable plans to showcase how we create value for our customers and impact business priorities
* Empowering people by identifying individual development opportunities to support growth and encourage them to share own ideas, concerns and learnings
* Driving performance by recognising individual contributions and collective victories to maintain a healthy balance through measurable goals and clear priorities for each team member
* Developing teams by nurturing a dynamic team culture, that emphasises trust and respect to ensure that everyone understands their unique value and contribution
* Fostering inclusion by creating equal opportunity through curiosity about all aspects of diversity in your team to evaluate habits and perspectives on a continuous basis


**What We Offer**
**People** 
 come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 29/10/2025.  For more information, you’re welcome to contact Krista Korelin, Head of Digital Sales and Engagement Business Banking at krista.korelin@nordea.com or tel. +358 504840654 (please call 20.10.2025 at 9-10 CET or 24.10.2025 at 10-11 CET).
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden** 
 : For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

title: Lösningsarkitekt inom Business intelligence till Knowit i Stockholm
description:
Vill du arbeta med den senaste tekniken och forma framtidens BI- och datalösningar? På Knowit Datalytics söker vi en Lösningsarkitekt som vill kombinera strategi och teknik för att utveckla innovativa analytics-lösningar – med målet att skapa en bättre och mer hållbar framtid!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En central och verksamhetskritisk roll där du arbetar med det senaste inom Microsoft ekosystem.
* En kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö med fokus på din personliga och professionella utveckling.
* Konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket med försäkring, pension, årsbonus och flexibla arbetstider.


**Om rollen och ditt team:**
 Hos Knowit Datalytics i Stockholm blir du en del av ett team om 50 skickliga specialister inom analytics och data management. Vi har en decentraliserad organisationsstruktur med snabba beslutsvägar, samtidigt som vi har kraften av en stor organisation med 4400 erfarna specialister i Sverige och Norden.
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt inom Business Intelligence arbetar du inom hela erbjudande- och leveranskedjan av analytics- och datamanagementlösningar, inklusive:
   

  

* Strategisk rådgivning, arkitektur och teknisk vägledning utifrån kundens behov.
* Design och implementation av analytics- och datamangement-lösningar
* Översätta behov till hållbara lösningar med kvalité och efterlevnad av IT- och säkerhetsföreskrifter


 Vi är övertygade om att AI inte bara förändrar hur vi löser tekniska problem, utan också hur vi samarbetar, kommunicerar och skapar värde. Därför söker vi dig som redan har testat, eller vill utforska, hur AI kan bidra till smartare arbetssätt och bättre resultat, både för oss själva och våra kunder.
   

  

**Om dig:**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett antal års erfarenhet inom rollen som lösningsarkitekt med erfarenhet av Microsoft data management produkter och tjänster, både onprem och i molnet. Vidare har du en teknisk bredd inom ETL och Data warehouse med ett intresse att arbeta nära tekniken.
   

  

 Som konsult har du en förmåga att samarbeta och anpassa din kommunikation för att förklara komplexa lösningar på olika nivåer. Du är lyhörd för behov, förutsättningar och möjligheter och kan omsätta dessa till tydliga mål och en effektiv leverans. Du är flytande i svenska och engelska.

title: Master thesis: Sustainability impact of enhanced ICT resilience
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 The Sustainability team within the Research Area Consumer & IndustryLab—an agile and diverse organization within Ericsson Research. We are driven by curiosity and a passion for shaping a sustainable, resilient and connected future by better understanding the needs and challenges amongst consumers, industries and society. Our research focuses on environmental impact assessment and the societal impact of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT).
   

  

 As digital infrastructure including supporting infrastructure that the IT resources are dependent on to be operational becomes increasingly critical to society, there is an urgent need to ensure its resilience without exacerbating its environmental impact.
   

  

 We are looking for 1 student for this position based in Stockholm.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Investigate trade-offs between redundancy for resilience and resource efficiency.
* Conduct literature reviews, and/or interviews with industry experts to gather insights and data.
* Investigate the role of AI and predictive analytics in optimizing both robustness and sustainability. The physical location of cloud services and AI resources as well as the demand of regional self-dependencies are also to be considered.
* The approach could be either to assess a “best case scenario” or a range between a technological “good enough” level and full access with no constraints.
* Based on the chosen scenario, identify important key elements, pain points, or factors to focus on going forward.
* Propose strategies for enhancing the resilience of ICT infrastructure that are aligned with efforts to reduce its environmental footprint.


**The skills you will bring:**
* Background in engineering with a focus on environmental sustainability.
* A strong interest in sustainability, digital infrastructure, and systems thinking.
* Familiarity with ICT systems and AI, data analytics, or predictive modeling.
* Strong analytical mindset.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Self-driven and organized, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.


**Application:**
 Please submit your application with a resume and academic transcripts from both your BSc and your MSc.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773625

title: Consultant in Financial Services (f|m|x)
description:
zeb is one of the leading strategy, management and IT consultancies specializing in financial services in Europe. We support banks, insurance companies and (tech) service providers in dealing with all the challenges and opportunities arising from transformation in the industry.
   

  

 Your tasks:
   

  

* Participate in projects on topics such as digitalization, sales optimization, reorganization, and merger integration.
* Analyze market trends and client needs to offer insights that assist managerial decisions.
* Shape the future of the financial industry and bring your curiosity regarding strategy, organization and process management to the table.
* Become part of a project team and create smart strategies for the further development of business models and the digital future of banks and insurance companies.
* Drive innovation and thought leadership, for instance by writing articles and mentoring future talent.


 Your skills:
   

  

* Master's or PhD in business administration or a related field.
* Experience in consulting or in the financial sector through relevant internships.
* You are team-oriented, reliable and inspire others with creative ideas.
* You think strategically and act responsibly when implementing concepts.
* You enjoy questioning the status quo.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English, German is a plus.


**Your Benefits**
* Training: Develop your strengths with us – and benefit from our comprehensive training program and language courses. In addition, individual seminars with external providers are possible if certain training programs are necessary yet unavailable in the general training catalog. Executive coaching: Regarding specific issues for executives, we offer training sessions in how to position oneself in the company, communication, leadership and negotiation management.
* Events: An important part of our culture is the exchange of thoughts and networking among colleagues. You have the opportunity to do so at numerous events, such as the Christmas Party, zeb.Uni, partner dinner or the "Beer & Pizza" format.
* Agile Working: In our agile workspaces there are no limits to your creativity. Whether SCRUM, Kanban or Design Thinking—this is where we transforms agile thoughts into action. You can find more about our offices here.
* Flexibility: To offer you the best possible flexibility, you don’t have to live in one of our locations to work with us: in addition to appointments with clients, you can choose to travel to the office or prefer to work from home. For this reason, you can choose your location as well as your Practice Group - project groups for specific topics - and easily change them over time, if needed. Individual coaching is very important to us. For this purpose, you will be assigned a mentor, in our case a CDC – Career Development Counselor. If you wish, you can easily change your CDC.


 Equal opportunities for all: we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds – regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. As an employer, we rely on people who like to try new things, take responsibility and inspire others through their actions.

title: Head of Compliance - Nordics
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Are you a strategic compliance leader with a sharp mind, a sense of humour, and a passion for enabling responsible business growth? Do you thrive on solving complex problems, building strong teams, and bridging the gap between compliance obligations and risk and commercial opportunity? If so - LeoVegas Group wants you.
   

  

 LeoVegas is a leading GameTech group at the cutting edge of mobile gaming innovation, operating globally through powerful brands like LeoVegas and BetMGM. Since being acquired by MGM Resorts International in 2022, we’ve been on a steep trajectory of transformation and expansion -and now we’re building a powerhouse Nordic compliance function to match.
   

  

 This is a rare opportunity to take the reins of compliance across the Nordics (Sweden, Denmark, and soon, Finland) - leading the way not just in governance, but in shaping the way compliance supports commercial success.
   

  

 As Head of Compliance – Nordics, you’ll be the go-to expert for senior Nordic management on all things compliance for our Nordic markets. You’ll lead a regional team (which factors in both dotted and direct line reports from the wider LeCo support function), sit at the table with commercial decision-makers, and be a critical link between the wider business and LeCo.
   

  

 This isn’t about saying "no" - it’s about knowing how to say “yes,” responsibly.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Build, lead and enable smooth processes and communication for a high-performing Nordic dedicated compliance team, covering Sweden, Denmark, and (upon licensing) Finland.
* Be the bridge between business and compliance: guiding commercial teams on regulatory obligations and embedding compliance into business decisions and working closely with other regional compliance heads to ensure consistency of Group reporting and risk.
* Partner closely with other verticals in LeCo - Privacy, Legal, Technical Compliance, AML Governance - to ensure cohesion and clarity and “one voice” from LeCo towards the business functions.
* Represent the Group with Nordic regulators and lead proactive engagement alongside our Policy & Regulatory Affairs team.
* Monitor and report on regional compliance and identify and take accountability for when issues or risks require central clearance, escalation, or consultation with the Group’s central LeCo functions rather than being decided in the regional management team ensuring transparency and alignment across Group.
* Stay ahead of regulatory developments, shape internal processes, and ensure we're always a step ahead.
* Own and manage all Nordic reporting obligations, including those to local regulators and MGM Resorts International.
* Maintain a “business partner” mindset - solving problems, not creating roadblocks.
* Promote collaboration across the Group to avoid silos and build consistent, scalable practices.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

* A Master’s degree in Law or a related field.
* Previous experience within iGaming.
* 5+ years’ experience in a senior compliance or regulatory role.
* Proven experience influencing policy, engaging regulators, and contributing to consultation responses.
* A track record of working closely with commercial teams and translating complex regulatory matters into practical business solutions.
* A passion for building and enabling teams.
* A sense of humour, resilience under pressure, and a team-first mindset.
* Native-level proficiency in Swedish.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 2000 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 19 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

title: Driven Growth Marketer? Let’s talk about your n...
description:
We’re always excited to connect with talented, curious, and driven people who want to make an impact. While there’s no open Growth Marketing role at the moment, we welcome ambitious marketers who’d like to stay in touch for future opportunities.
   

  

 How we’re driving growth at Twigeo
   

  

 As a creative performance agency, we help apps grow, scale, and win by combining creativity with data-driven strategy. That takes curiosity, and here, it’s not just encouraged, it’s part of the job. You’ll constantly be exploring new channels, tactics, and creative angles to test.
   

  

 We’re serious about growth but never too serious about ourselves, and we like to keep things fun while chasing the next big win together. You’ll be part of a fun, international team across New York, Los Angeles, Stockholm, and Varna, always cheering each other on.
   

  

 Why you’d love working as a Growth Marketer at Twigeo
   

  

 At Twigeo, you’ll run high-impact campaigns for some of the world’s leading apps, think big budgets, bold experiments, and endless opportunities to learn fast. One day, you’re building media plans and running campaigns across Meta, Google, TikTok, or Snap. Next, you’re teaming up with creatives to test bold new hooks or working with analysts to turn numbers into insights that actually mean something. You’ll spot trends early, try new channels before they’re mainstream, and be the go-to person your clients trust to drive performance forward.
   

  

 Who are we looking for?
   

  

 You Might Be a Recent Graduate, Early In Your Career, Or Already Working In Marketing. What Matters Most Is That You Are
   

  

* Curious and analytical
* Creative and eager to experiment
* Collaborative and excited about growth


 💬
 **Do you have any questions?** 
 Feel free to reach out to lisa@twigeo.com.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, apply below! We’d be happy to stay in touch for future opportunities.

title: Senior Search Engineer - ML
description:
**About us** 




 RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals and organizations rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. Our products help clients enhance their decision-making by quantifying the impact of media sentiment and attention.
 



 Our clients include the world’s most successful hedge funds, banks, and government agencies. As we continue to grow, we're looking for passionate, technically skilled professionals to join our Search Team.
 



  





**Join RavenPack:** 




 At RavenPack, we are scaling new heights with our search technologies. We have a strong foundation and a talented team dedicated to solving complex challenges in information retrieval for the world's top financial professionals. Our mission is to architect and build the most sophisticated, scalable, and intelligent search engine in the market, powering
 
 Bigdata.com
 
 .
 



 To accelerate our innovation and redefine the standards of excellence in our industry, we are looking for a Senior Search Engineer to join our Search Team. This is a strategic role where you will act as a force multiplier, bringing specialized expertise in search systems to enhance our team's capabilities. We are looking for a hands-on engineer who is passionate about building production systems and thrives on optimizing every layer of the search stack—from low-level infrastructure to advanced ML-driven relevance.
 



 If you are driven to build world-class systems and are excited by the opportunity to elevate a strong platform to its full potential, this is your chance to make a definitive impact.
 



***European legal working status is required.***




  





**What You'll Be Doing** 



* Own the Search Infrastructure: Architect and develop our next-generation search infrastructure. Become a to-go expert for all things search-related.
* Build for Speed & Scale: Design, build, and maintain high-throughput, low-latency APIs for search, retrieval and query processing. Your work will directly impact the performance and reliability of our products.
* Productionize ML for search: In close partnership with our ML engineers and data scientists, implement and productionize state-of-the-art query understanding and ranking models. Optimize pipelines for generating and serving semantic embeddings at scale, leveraging vector search and modern language models.
* Drive Engineering & Experimentation Velocity: Establish best practices for search development and testing. Build tools and processes that empower the team to experiment and innovate rapidly and safely.
* Performance Tuning & Optimization: Profile and optimize every component of the search stack, from indexing and query processing to model inference, ensuring maximum efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
* Collaborate and Mentor: Work closely with product managers, engineers and data scientists to translate business needs into technical reality. Mentor team members, elevating their understanding of search systems and engineering best practices.
* Stay Ahead of the Curve: Actively evaluate emerging trends in ML, NLP, and Information Retrieval, prototyping new ideas to maintain our competitive edge.



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* 5+ years of hands-on professional experience building and scaling production systems, with a deep focus on information retrieval.
* Deep, practical experience with modern search technologies. Hands-on experience working with and scaling vector databases
 *(Vespa is preferred).*
* Strong programming skills in
 **Python.** 
 Practical experience with
 **Java** 
 is a strong plus.
* Solid understanding of machine learning concepts applied to search (learning-to-rank, embeddings, language model quantization…).
* Experience in environments where search quality is measured through offline evaluation, human-in-the-loop systems, or content-based heuristics.
* Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills. You can break down complex, ambiguous problems into concrete, actionable steps.
* Clear, concise, and effective communication skills in English. You can articulate complex technical ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.



  





**Bonus Points:** 



* Direct, in-depth experience building and operating systems on Vespa.
* Experience in the financial data domain.
* Experience with MLOps tools and CI/CD pipelines in a cloud environment.



  





**What's in it for you?** 



* Growth Opportunity: Join a rapidly growing company with 180+ team members with offices in New York, Madrid, and Marbella, building AI that truly matters for business and finance.
* International Culture: Be part of a diverse, global organization with a truly international culture.
* Team of Superstars: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, including Silicon Valley executives and Wall Street veterans.
* Competitive Compensation: We offer a highly competitive salary package and performance-based bonuses.
* Full Remote
* Relocation Assistance: Comprehensive relocation support is available to help you and your family move to the beautiful Costa del Sol, if you are willing to relocate
* Work-Life Balance: Enjoy paid vacation, flexible time-off, and a flexible work policy.
* Continuous learning: We provide the support needed to grow within the team.

title: Sr Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea | Stockholm
description:
**Senior Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea 🚀**
 At
 **Apotea** 
 , Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, we’re reshaping how healthcare reaches people — smarter, faster, and more sustainably. Every system we optimize and every line of code we write brings us closer to a society where better health is accessible for everyone.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to take a leading role in developing and scaling the systems that power our entire operation — from seamless customer experiences to world-class logistics.
   

  

 This isn’t a role for someone who wants “just another dev job.” This is your chance to be part of a purpose-driven tech journey where your impact goes far beyond code.
   

  

**💡 Why this role matters**
 At Apotea, technology isn’t a support function — it’s our competitive edge. You’ll be joining the
 **core of Apoteas tech team** 
 , where uptime, performance, and innovation meet real-world impact. You’ll help us design and evolve the complex systems that keep millions of deliveries moving, pharmacies stocked, and customers cared for every single day.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead by doing — combining deep technical skill with curiosity, initiative, and collaboration.
   

  

**👩‍💻 What You’ll Do**
**Design, build, and evolve** 
 high-performance systems that keep Apotea running at scale.
   

  

**Lead technical direction** 
 within projects and mentor other developers through complex problem-solving.
   

  

**Drive innovation** 
 through automation, modernization, and new integrations — from logistics partners to sister companies.
   

  

**Collaborate across teams** 
 to bridge business needs and technical execution.
   

  

**Strengthen reliability and scalability** 
 across our .NET ecosystem — keeping millions of transactions flowing seamlessly.
   

  

**Shape the future** 
 of Apotea’s tech landscape — your ideas will influence how we grow.
   

  

**🧠 Who You Are**
 You’re an experienced engineer who loves tackling complexity and turning it into clarity. You thrive in fast-paced environments where real impact is visible every day. You’re both hands-on and strategic — equally comfortable writing elegant .NET code as you are leading architectural discussions.
   

  

**You’ll Fit Right In If You**
* Write clean, maintainable C#/.NET code with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Understand system architecture, distributed systems, and data flow in complex environments.
* Have strong problem-solving and debugging skills — you stay calm under pressure and focused on solutions.
* Enjoy mentoring, sharing knowledge, and lifting others around you.
* Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.


**🌟 Extra kudos if you bring**
 Experience in
 **logistics, e-commerce, or ERP/WMS systems** 
 .
   

  

 Familiarity with
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 ,
 **DevOps** 
 , or automation tools.
   

  

 A background in
 **integration projects** 
 or migration work.
   

  

 Swedish language skills — a plus, not a must.
   

  

**What Apotea Offers You**
 ✨ A role where your code impacts millions of people.
   

  

 ✨ The chance to work in Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company.
   

  

 ✨ An agile, flat organization where ideas matter more than titles.
   

  

 ✨ Growth opportunities: training, mentorship, and conferences.
   

  

 ✨ A collaborative, transparent culture where your voice counts.
   

  

 ✨ A meaningful mission – making healthcare more accessible while caring for the planet.
   

  

**❤️ About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Årsta, Lidingö, Morgongåva and Varberg.
   

  

 Follow us on social media to stay up to date on everything that's happening at Apotea
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
* Apply
* Screening interview
* Technical interview
* Culture fit interview
* Background check (mandatory in pharmacy industry)
* Offer 🎉


 📍 Location: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm
   

  

 🏢 Work model: We work on-site
   

  

 👤 Reports to: Head of IT Operations
   

  

**Ready to join the journey?**
 Don’t wait – interviews happen continuously, and the role may be filled quickly. Apply today and be part of building something bigger than just software.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health, and your work creates real change.*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Service Maintenance Marketing Manager
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**Elekta - Hope for everyone dealing with cancer** 

 In our world, billions of people, millions of cancers diagnosed each year. For everyone, it’s personal. Behind every treatment lies a story, a family, a future.
   

  

 Behind every patient, clinic, and care provider, are real complexities, real needs, and a united purpose. We’re not intimidated, we’re inspired, because every difference – from the smallest tumor change to the greatest clinical challenge is a chance to innovate together and advance care. That’s why we’re here. With you. To set the new standard of care, making a meaningful impact on lives, for a world of difference.
   

  

**Provide exceptional service and seamless execution across the customer journey**
 Step into a role where your work directly enhances patient care and clinical excellence. At Elekta, our Services team is driving value in radiation oncology through Elekta Care— the most comprehensive and data-driven service offering in radiation oncology delivered in a personal way. From proactive maintenance and lifecycle upgrades to expert implementation and peer-to-peer training. Elekta Care ensures minimized clinical downtime and maximized patient throughput. Join us and be part of a team that empowers healthcare providers with the tools, support, and insights they need to deliver life-changing treatments.
   

  

**We're looking for a Service Maintenance Marketing Manager** 
 to lead the global marketing strategy for our maintenance service portfolio - including our flagship Elekta Care Service Agreements. This role is not just about managing services—it’s about transforming how we deliver value to our customers at every stage of their journey.
   

  

**What you’ll do at Elekta** 

 This role is responsible for designing and executing marketing strategies that drive customer engagement, satisfaction, and revenue across the maintenance service portfolio. It blends strategic product marketing with operational excellence, ensuring the maintenance portfolio is positioned for success. Acting as a bridge between product/service development and market adoption, the Service Maintenance Marketing Manager ensures every stage of the customer journey—from onboarding to renewal—is optimized for value delivery, customer retention, and business growth.
   

  

 Your role will include (but not limited to):
   

  

**New Service Introductions:**
* Conduct market research and trend analysis to inform strategic decisions on new maintenance service concepts.
* Identify and develop offerings that drive business growth and deliver customer value, including business case creation, opportunity assessment, and customer needs evaluation.
* Lead go-to-market planning, execution, and strategy for new service introductions, including global launch plan, messaging, and sales enablement.


**Maintenance Service Portfolio:**
* Define a compelling vision for the global maintenance service portfolio.
* Oversee all entitlements (e.g., uptime, spare parts, support, remote) that are included in the maintenance offering—from launch to renewal and retention—ensuring consistent value delivery.
* Manage positioning and pricing strategies, adapting to diverse markets and customer segments.
* Ensure market readiness through the New Service Introduction (NSI) process, including completion of deliverables and effective knowledge transfer.
* Drive service contract renewals, point-of-sale initiatives, and customer loyalty programs.


**Strategy & Planning:**
* Develop and execute comprehensive marketing strategies for service portfolios, aligned with business objectives and market trends.
* Analyse market trends, customer insights, and competitive landscapes to inform service marketing initiatives.


**Campaigns & Communications:**
* Develop compelling service positioning, messaging, and value propositions tailored to customer needs and competitive advantages.
* Plan and execute integrated marketing campaigns (digital, print, events, PR) to promote service offerings and drive customer engagement.


**Sales Enablement:**
* Create and distribute sales tools, training materials, and collateral to support the sales team in communicating service value (e.g., sales collateral, presentation, customer-facing content).
* Collaborate with sales, product, and regional marketing teams to ensure alignment and successful execution of marketing strategies.


**Collaboration Support:**
* Provide services and installed base marketing expertise to regional activities and co-strategize marketing programs with regional teams.
* Participate in regular marketing meetings and support high-level sales and internal training as required.
* Orchestrate cross-functional activities to design service products that deliver new value in new ways for customers. Translate the converged service portfolio strategy into defined service products/offerings. Partner and align with regional leaders, other category product management leaders, and service delivery management on an integrated roadmap in early-stage ideation to ensure the effective delivery of all services.


**The Right Capabilities**
* Excellent downstream marketing skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional, global teams.
* Strong interpersonal skills and stakeholder management experience.
* Self-motivated and able to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Ability to communicate in business, marketing and product management user terms
* Self-motivated and committed to best practice solutions.


**What you’ll bring** 

* We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we're looking for!
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Healthcare Administration, or related field; advanced degree preferred.
* 3-5 years of experience in healthcare marketing, with a proven track record of managing service (maintenance) portfolios.
* Strong understanding of healthcare industry regulations, customer journey mapping, and digital marketing tools.
* Experience with CRM, marketing automation, and analytics platforms.
* Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus.


**What you will get** 
  

  

 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, Elekta offers a range of benefits depending on the location where you apply.
   

  

*Please note that for all locations, working in a hybrid model (3 days in the office) is required.*
**Hiring process** 

  

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact** 

  

  

 For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Joanna Kozyra at Joanna.Kozyra@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer.** 

  

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Creative Patternmaker
description:
Acne Studios is a progressive luxury house and through collaboration and curiosity, we set high aspirations and strive for excellence. We value everyone’s contribution and embrace feedback to develop ourselves and others. We aim to minimise our environmental impact across all our operations and to address societal challenges in the way we conduct our business.
   

  

 As Creative Patternmaker at our Stockholm Office you will be responsible for delivering high quality patterns to our in-house atelier or suppliers for the designated product group. In this role, you will take full ownership of pattern quality - from sketch handover to production launch.
   

  

 CULTURE OF COLLABORATION
   

  

 We firmly believe that when you feel supported, included, and trusted, it enables you to enjoy your work and thrive in it. You will be a part of a team of colleagues with diverse roles and backgrounds, each with their unique skills and experiences.
   

  

 WHAT YOU WILL DO
   

  

 As Creative Patternmaker your main contribution will be to create high quality patterns for dedicated product categories. You will report to Senior Head Patternmaker in Stockholm and your role may require occasional travels. You will play a vital role by:
   

  

* Participate in fit sessions and provide proactive input to ensure further development and production processes run smoothly
* Responsible for pattern quality from sketch handover to production launch
* Interact closely with inhouse atelier regarding construction and finishings
* Work closely with cross functional partners of the designated product group during the development process, show preparations and production phase
* Serve as a technical resource to product development and design teams
* Contribute during the development process and production phase to ensure consistency in sizing and grading in close cross functional collaboration


 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You have high aspirations and focus on details that create substantial impact. You enjoy working as a team and you embrace feedback to develop yourself and others. You are curious and thrive in a dynamic environment. Cooperation, respect, and clear communication are important, along with your ambition to learn and grow. If these qualities speak to you, we would love to have you on our team.
   

  

 Specific personal qualities for this role:
   

  

* Organized, detail-oriented with strong follow-through
* Cooperative, positive mind set and a team player
* Ability to efficiently work towards tight deadlines


 Specific experience and knowledge for this role:
   

  

* Academic degree within design and/or patternmaking
* Minimum 4-6 years’ experience as a pattern maker preferably in an international high-end fashion brand
* Strong communication skills in written and spoken English with a good command of English technical terms
* Technical expertise in patternmaking and garment construction
* Good understanding of the creative process and creative in experimental pattern solutions
* Proficient in a CAD pattern software (Gerber, Lectra, etc.) and CLO
* Fluent in English


 Please submit your portfolio with your application.
   

  

 What matters most to us is not whether you master all the listed knowledge and skills. We are dedicated to recognising the potential in each individual. We embrace diversity of people as well as ideas and viewpoints and encourage everyone's individual expression of their own identity.

title: AWS Public Sector Senior Cloud Architect - Databases
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Senior Delivery Consultant - Databases to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Senior Delivery Consultant - Databases you will be proficient in work with customers to migrate their database environments to AWS, architecting complex, scalable, and secure database solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS.
   

  

 As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS database solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation
* 5+ years of experience on at least one commercial relational database (Oracle, SQL, Server, IBM, DB2) or open source database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB)
* Knowledge on non-relational database (MongoDB, CouchDB, Redis)
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Ability to communicate effectively in English in technical and business settings


**Preferred Qualifications**
* 5+ years of external or internal customer facing, complex and large scale implementation experience
* Experience with automation and scripting (e.g., Terraform, Python) and expertise in performance optimization and cost management for cloud environments
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) and knowledge of the primary AWS services (EC2, ELB, RDS, Route53, S3)


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3070137

title: Bar Supervisor
description:
*About Clarion Hotel: Clarion Hotel® is not just a hotel chain; it's an immersive experience that combines Scandinavian hospitality with a touch of premium. Our team members are not merely employees; they are an integral part of the Clarion experience. We pride ourselves on delivering on personality, passion, and we always strive for perfection. Join us in shaping the future of hospitality! Clarion Hotel® is part of Strawberry.*
**Clarion Hotel Sign,** 
 ett av Stockholms största hotell med 558 rum, söker en serviceminded, operativ Bar Supervisor till The Social Bar & Bistro.
   

  

 Jag som rekryterar heter Linn Henriksson och jobbar som Restaurant & Bar Manager på Clarion Hotel Sign. Som ledare är jag senior, tydlig och driven. Vi har fartfyllda dagar med mycket omväxling, där ingen dag är den andra lik. Det är viktigt att du som ny stjärna till vårt team är flexibel och vill lära dig nya saker, tycka om att ta dig an utmaningar och ha roligt på jobbet.
   

  

**Om Clarion Hotel Sign:**
 Clarion Hotel Sign är mer än bara ett hotell – det är en pulserande mötesplats i hjärtat av Stockholm, perfekt beläget intill Centralstationen. Här finns restaurang The Social Bar & Bistro på entréplan och Selma City Spa på våning åtta med sin härliga rooftop pool. I huset har vi en stor konferensvåning med mötesrum för alla tillfällen och en bankettsal som rymmer upp till 600 personer.
   

  

 Vi tror på att utveckla oss själva och varandra för att alla ska kunna nå sin fulla potential. Vi är övertygade om att ge bäst service i stan och därför genomför alla medarbetare en serviceutbildning. Vi är optimistiska, uppmärksamma och professionella. På Clarion Hotel kan gästen förvänta sig hög kvalitet, fantastisk service och en vibrerande atmosfär. Perfekt läge och smakfull design gör Clarion Hotel Sign till den ultimata platsen oavsett om gästen är här på affärsresa eller nöje. Välkommen till ett hotell som aldrig sover!
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden:**
* Leda och fördela arbetet under arbetspasset.
* Att tillsammans med avdelningens team skapa en oförglömlig upplevelse för våra gäster.
* Att ha en tät dialog med arrangemangets projektledare och ta information vidare till berörda på avdelningen.
* Att leda och driva arbetet med merförsäljning på avdelningen.
* Säkerställa att den månatliga inventeringen genomförs i tid och rapporteras till närmaste chef.
* I samråd med närmsta chef arbetar man med schemaläggning, upplärning och utbildning. Dagligen registrera korrekt antal timmar i tidrapporteringssystem (Timeplan) för alla medarbetare.
* I samråd med närmsta chef se till att beställningar av dryck och förbrukningsvaror tillhörande avdelningen utförs.
* Att säkerställa att alkohollagen efterföljs.
* Att skapa och redigera menyer.
* Att säkerställa att teamet kan kassasystemet (Munu) och uppdatera systemet med aktuella produkter.
* Att säkerhetsställa bokningar i ( Munu booking).


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Är ordningsam, punktlig, serviceminded och har hög arbetsmoral samt god social kompetens och ett glatt humör.
* Är prestigelös.
* Är kreativ och lösningsorienterad.
* Har erfarenhet av liknande arbete och ledarskap i minst 5 år.
* Har förmågan att arbeta självständigt och i team under snabba och oförutsägbara händelser.
* Har en sommelier utbildning (meriterande)
* Utbildad Barista (meriterande)
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


**Vi erbjuder:**
 🏨 En unik möjlighet att arbeta på ett av Stockholms mest spännande hotell
   

  

 💡 En kreativ och utvecklande miljö med fokus på lagarbete
   

  

 🚀 En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där ingen dag är den andra lik
   

  

 🤝 Möjlighet att leverera service i världsklass
   

  

 🍓 Fina personalförmåner såsom rabatterade priser på hotellnätter och restaurangbesök i hela Norden
   

  

 🏋 Tillgång till Fit & Fab gym och pt-ledda träningspass två gånger i veckan
   

  

 🥦 God personalmat
   

  

**Anställningsvillkor:**
* Deltid 75% -majoritet kvällstid.
* Vardagar, helger och storhelger.
* Lön enligt kollektivavtal.


**Vi erbjuder dig** 
 en föränderlig miljö där den ena dagen inte är den andra lika, lön enligt kollektivavtal med schysta villkor och naturligtvis får du ta del av våra personalförmåner när du anställs hos oss. Personal förmånerna är superbra, vad tror du om att till exempel kunna boka hotellrum på Strawberry Hotels till specialpris, möjlighet att träna på Clarion Signs gym med mera?
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Corporate Legal Counsel
description:
**About Us** 




**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**The role** 




 We are seeking a talented
 **Legal Counsel – Corporate & Commercial** 
 with 3–5 years of post-qualification experience to join our in-house legal team. This role offers the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, international environment, advising on a wide range of commercial, corporate, and contractual matters.
 



 Reporting to the
 **Senior Legal Manager** 
 , you will provide legal guidance across the business, ensuring that risks are identified, managed, and communicated effectively, while supporting business objectives. You will work closely with colleagues across multiple jurisdictions and functions, helping to drive compliance, efficiency, and sound decision-making.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Support corporate governance and company secretarial matters, including board- and shareholder documentation and filings.
* Draft, review, and negotiate a wide range of commercial agreements, including supplier, customer, licensing, and service contracts.
* Contribute to policy development and implementation of legal frameworks, templates, and processes.
* Liaise with external counsel where specialist advice is required, ensuring cost-effective and practical solutions.
* Partner with internal stakeholders in order to ensure effective and practical solutions and processes, including but not limited to, identification and management of legal risks in commercial activities.
* Advise on cross-border contractual arrangements and ensure compliance with applicable corporate and commercial law.
* Support procurement and commercial teams with contract lifecycle management.
* Support training initiatives to raise legal and contractual awareness within the business.



 Compliance obligations
 


* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





**How will success be measured in this role** 



* Acting in line with FDJ UNITED values
* Successful completion of all relevant training and other compliance activities that support FDJ's sustainable and responsible growth



  





**Your experience** 



* Qualified lawyer with 3–5 years of experience in corporate and commercial law (in-house and/or private practice background). Experience from international and multijurisdictional environments is meritorious.
* Exposure to corporate law matters, including governance, structuring and contacts with relevant authorities.
* Solid experience drafting and negotiating a broad range of commercial contracts.
* Strong business acumen and ability to balance legal risks with commercial objectives.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain complex issues clearly and pragmatically.
* Strong organisational skills with the ability to prioritise and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Proactive, solutions-oriented, and able to work both independently and collaboratively.
* Fluency in English is required and proficiency in French is a strong asset.



  





**Our Way Of Working** 




 Our world is hybrid.
 



 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Kommunikatör till operativ roll
description:
Vi söker dig som vill ta dig an och utvecklas i en operativ kommunikatörsroll. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Kommunikationsenheten består i dag av två erfarna kommunikatörer och en kommunikationschef. Vi stödjer ca 650 kollegor på serviceförvaltningen och jobbar för att planerad kommunikation både ska bidra till förtroendet för vår verksamhet i Region Stockholm och till en produktiv organisation där medarbetare känner delaktighet.
   

  

 Rollen som kommunikatör innebär att arbeta operativt för att stödja verksamheten och de övergripande målen. Du kommer arbeta med vårt nyhetsflöde och annan produktion – allt från idé och research till att intervjua, skriva, fota, filma, redigera och publicera i digitala kanaler. Du kommer också delta i planering och genomförande av möten och utbildningar, gå in som stöd till dina kommunikatörskollegor och även publicera och genomföra sådant som planerats av andra.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta självständigt och ha många kontaktytor i organisationen. Kommunikationsenheten är en liten, engagerad grupp och det är en självklarhet att samarbeta, rådfråga och vara bollplank till varandra.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har en högskoleutbildning inom kommunikation, och vi tror att du är ganska ny i yrket med viljan att utvecklas i en operativ roll. Du är serviceinriktad, självgående och vill uppnå resultat i arbetet. Det är viktigt att du tycker om att skriva och använda ord och bild för att nå fram till andra. Du tycker om att samarbeta, har social kompetens och lätt för att knyta kontakter. Du har också lätt för att sätta dig in i nya digitala verktyg och plattformar.
   

  

 För att passa för rollen har du:
   

  

* Högskole- eller universitetsexamen inom kommunikationsområdet.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att göra intervjuer och research och skriva nyhetsliknande texter.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skapa kommunikativt innehåll i form av text, bild och video.
* God kunskap i Microsoft 365, främst Word, PowerPoint och Teams.
* God kunskap i Adobe Creative Suite, främst Photoshop, Indesign och Premiere.
* Erfarenhet av webbpublicering.


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du dessutom har:
   

  

* Kunskap i Optimizely (cms).
* Kunskap i Illustrator (Adobe Creative Suite).
* Erfarenhet av eventproduktion.


 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Som kommunikatör hos oss får du möjlighet att växa i yrket i ett nära samarbete med erfarna kollegor. Vi tror också att du har kunskaper och erfarenheter som gör att vi andra utvecklas. Du kommer in i en ung organisation där kommunikationsenheten fortfarande håller på att etablera sig. Här får du delta i utvecklingen av en effektiv kommunikationsverksamhet som stödjer organisationens övergripande mål.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Normalt är vi på kontoret minst tre dagar i veckan. Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler på Lindhagensgatan. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta kommunikationschef, Jenny Brask: jenny.brask@regionstockholm.se.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Det här är en arbetsplats för dig som gillar att ge service och vill att din insats ska göra skillnad. Vi på serviceförvaltningen ska underlätta vardagen för våra kollegor i Region Stockholms kärnverksamheter så att de kan fokusera på patienter, resenärer, invånare och besökare. Vi är 700 personer som arbetar med inköp och upphandling, löne- och personaladministration, ekonomi- och redovisningsadministration, it och medicinsk teknik, användarstöd, lokalservice med mera. Varmt välkommen till en arbetsplats där du blir en del av något större! Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Vårdadministrativ enhetschef
description:
Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset söker en drivande och utvecklingsinriktad vårdadministrativ enhetschef. I denna nyckelroll får du möjlighet att leda och utveckla den administrativa verksamheten – med fokus på att skapa en vård som är patientsäker, högkvalitativ, tillgänglig och värdeskapande.
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* Ett meningsfullt uppdrag där du bidrar till framtidens vård genom att utveckla vårdadministrativa metoder och arbetssätt.
* En arbetsplats med hög kompetens, starkt engagemang och tydlig riktning mot innovation och förbättring.
* Möjlighet att leda ett mycket kompetent team i en miljö där samverkan, tillit och utveckling står i centrum och där ni gemensamt skapar en arbetsplats att längta till.
* Ett nära samarbete med vårdens chefer och stödfunktioner i ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Verksamhetsområde (VO) Vårdadministration är en central funktion på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset som samlar sjukhusets vårdadministrativa kompetens under Stab Produktion. Med cirka 640 medarbetare – medicinska sekreterare, administratörer och chefsassistenter – säkerställer vi att vårddokumentation, diagnos- och åtgärdsregistrering, fakturering samt övrig administrativ service håller hög kvalitet och bidrar till en effektiv och patientsäker vård. Genom nära samarbete med vårdens olika yrkeskategorier och ett kontinuerligt fokus på utveckling av rutiner och arbetssätt är verksamhetsområdet en nyckelspelare i sjukhusets dagliga drift och långsiktiga förbättringsarbete.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en vårdadministrativ enhetschef till enheten för Bäckencancer samt Hematologi (S) där du leder du din enhet i linje med Karolinskas vision, mål och strategier. Du omsätter beslut till konkret handling och säkerställer att det administrativa stödet håller hög kvalitet, är effektivt organiserat och bidrar till vårdens helhet.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för:
   

  

* Resursplanering, arbetsmiljö och kompetensutveckling
* Att driva systematiskt förbättringsarbete och följa upp mål och nyckeltal
* Att främja en inkluderande arbetsmiljö med tydlig kommunikation och kultur
* Att bidra till helheten inom vårdadministrationen och främja ett gott samarbete mellan olika enheter för att skapa en effektiv och kvalitativ verksamhet
* Att driva utveckling och säkerställa god samverkan med andra chefer, vårdpersonal och stödfunktioner inom sjukhuset


 Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta som chef på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset här.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* Har ett närvarande och tydligt ledarskap som skapar engagemang och delaktighet
* Är prestigelös och har ett öppet och lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt
* Är strategisk och har förmåga att omsätta mål till handling
* Trivs med att arbeta i en komplex organisation där samverkan är avgörande
* Har god kommunikativ förmåga och kan inspirera till förändring och utveckling


**Kvalifikationer**
 Krav:
   

  

* Utbildning inom hälso- och sjukvård, gärna medicinsk sekreterare
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap inom hälso- och sjukvård eller likvärdig administration
* Erfarenhet av att leda och driva förändring, innovation och förbättringsarbete
* God insikt i hur vårdens arbetsflöden fungerar och förstår vikten av service och effektiva administrativa stödstrukturer
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift
* God IT-vana i Windows-miljö och Office 365


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av chefsuppdrag med personalansvar
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Goda kunskaper om digitalisering, AI och automation inom sjukvården


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan ske löpande, så sök gärna så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 I vår rekryteringsprocess kan vi komma att använda oss av Assessios tester MAP och Matrigma. MAP är ett personlighetstest och Matrigma är ett icke-verbalt begåvningstest och båda bygger på arbetspsykologisk forskning. Testerna används som ett komplement till dina erfarenheter och kompetenser och syftet är att göra vår urvalsprocess kvalitetssäker och transparent.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
