title: Laboratory Engineer
description:
*Are you passionate about laboratory challenges? Do you have interest* *and experience in* *robotics* *,* *programming* *and automation? Are you looking for the next step in your career?* *We are now looking for a* *Laboratory Engineer* *with a background in* *programming, automation, and robotics* *to join our team in Gothenburg. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the development of* *modern* *laboratory methods and equipment, while also supporting daily laboratory operations.*

**About the** **R** **ole**
---------------------------

Our Professional Hygiene laboratory is home of the Tork product range, with a focus on verifying our Tork dispenser systems . As a Lab oratory Engineer, you will play a dual role: supporting standard lab engineering tasks and leading or supporting initiatives to automate and enhance our laboratory methods and processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement solutions that improve efficiency, precision, and scalability in our laboratory environment.


You will be responsible for the product verification and testing as part of an innovation or product development project as well as supporting our mills or sale functions in the geographical business units. You will plan, perform and evaluate laboratory testing on products in the Tork Portfolio . You will be part of a team of many laboratory engineers with different experiences and backgrounds where you will contribute with your knowledge and expertise in the area.


We are particularly interested in candidates with experience in **Universal Robots (UR)** and a passion for integrating robotics into laboratory workflows.


This is a permanent position based in Mölndal.  



**What** **Y** **ou** **W** **ill** **D** **o**
-----------------------------------------------

* Plan, propose and perform evaluation and laboratory testing on our products with main focus on Dispensers.
* Present, document and report test results.
* Develop, test, and implement automation solutions for lab oratory processes and equipment.
* Perform data analyses and statistical evaluations as base for your evaluation .
* Program and operate UR robots and surrounding systems to support method development.
* Maintain, calibrate and troubleshoot laboratory systems and software.
* Develop, evaluate, and validate new laboratory methods to meet consumer and business needs.
**Who** **Y** **ou** **A** **re**
---------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in a technical field such as Mechanical Engineering, Automation, Electronics, Materials, or equivalent education and/or relevant work experience
* Experience from laboratory work or product testing in a global setting is an advantage
* Preferably experience from working with statistical analysis and analytical programs
* Basic proven programming skills and experience or curiosity about Robotics/Automation
* Experience with UR Robots is ideal but not essential
* Good communication and presentation skills in written reports as well as in discussions
* Written and verbal fluency in English
**Application**
---------------

Interested? If you are up for the challenge and think this sounds like you, apply online today! Kindly note that due to GDPR we will not accept applications via mail.


As we will be making ongoing selections, interviews might start before the application deadline. Please use the link to apply via our career site. We may conduct background checks in the final stages of the recruitment process to verify your qualifications and fit for the role.  



**What We Can Offer You**  

Our purpose, Breaking Barriers to Well-Being, provides meaning to everything we do. Join us to improve well-being for people and drive positive change for society and the environment. At Essity, you'll feel valued, empowered to grow, and challenged to achieve business results in a collaborative and open atmosphere. Innovate for Good | Excel Together | Be You with Us

-------------------------

28 okt. 2025

title: Junior Diagnostik ingenjör inom fordonsindustrin
description:
Om tjänsten
  
Maxitech söker nu en diagnostikingenjör till en av Sveriges ledande industrikoncerner inom tunga fordon och maskiner. Uppdraget är placerat i Eskilstuna och innebär att arbeta i ett globalt utvecklingsteam som driver teknikskiftet mot en mer hållbar, uppkopplad och smart framtid.
  
  

Rollen är teoretiskt inriktad och innebär att utveckla och dokumentera strategier för felsökning och diagnos, samt att testa dessa på maskiner. Informationen som tas fram används sedan i eftermarknaden av servicetekniker världen över.
  
  

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag, vilket innebär att du kommer att bli anställd av oss på Maxitech. Om allt känns bra i samarbetet kan det finnas en möjlighet till överrekrytering till kunden på sikt.
  
  

Du erbjuds
  
* En möjlighet att bli en del av ett globalt utvecklingsteam som arbetar med den senaste tekniken inom fordonselektronik och mekatronik.
* En roll med stort utrymme för lärande, samarbete och tekniskt ansvar.
* Generös kompetensutvecklingspott som du kan använda för att utveckla dina färdigheter


Arbetsuppgifter
  
I rollen som diagnostikingenjör arbetar du nära mjukvaru- och systemutvecklare samt andra ingenjörer inom diagnos och verifiering. Du kommer att bidra till att förbättra felsökningsstödet redan under utvecklingsfasen och därmed lägga grunden för hög kvalitet i produktens hela livscykel. Arbetet präglas av samarbete, struktur och noggrannhet. Rollen är mer teoretisk än praktisk, men innehåller praktiska moment vid verifiering på maskin.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar bland annat:**  

* Analys av felkoder och uppbyggnad av felsökningsträd.
* Framtagning av teoretiska felsökningsstrategier och beställning av kodningsarbete till utvecklingsteam utomlands.
* Verifiering av implementerad felsökningslogik i maskiner.
* Dokumentation av resultat och felanalysstöd för eftermarknaden.


Din profil
  
  

**Krav:**  

* Civil- eller högskoleingenjör inom mekatronik, elektronik, reglerteknik, maskinteknik eller motsvarande.
* Förståelse för fordonssystem, sensorer och kommunikationsprotokoll.
* God förmåga att läsa, analysera och dokumentera teknisk information.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift. Svenska är meriterande.


**Meriterande:**  

* Erfarenhet av diagnostik, test eller verifiering inom fordon eller maskin.
* Kännedom om embedded software och signalhantering.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) eller liknande testsystem.


Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, strukturerad och samarbetsvillig. Det krävs en analytisk förmåga och intresse för att förstå helheten i komplexa tekniska system – samtidigt som man kan fördjupa sig i detaljer. Rollen passar särskilt väl för en nyutexaminerad ingenjör med rätt tekniskt tänk och nyfikenhet på fordonsteknologi.
  
  

Övrigt
  
**Placering:** Eskilstuna
  
**Start:** Januari
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
  

Om oss
  
Maxitech är ett konsultbolag inom IT/Tech som arbetar med branschens vassaste konsulter. Vi erbjuder även direktrekrytering till våra kunder och skräddarsyr lösningar efter deras behov.

title: Senior Preservation Engineer
description:
JOD DESCRIPTION
  
The Senior Preservation Engineer plays a critical role in ensuring that all project materials, components, and systems are maintained in optimal condition from the time of procurement through installation, commissioning, and handover. This position is essential to protecting the integrity and quality of materials and equipment used in a large-scale industrial infrastructure project. The Preservation Engineer will work closely with procurement, construction, quality, and logistics teams to implement and oversee preservation strategies.
  
  

**1. Responsibilities:****Safety & Compliance:**  

Always adhere to and promote the safety policies of the project. Ensure that all works are executed in accordance with the applicable regulations.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Preservation Planning:** Develop and implement preservation plans and procedures tailored to the specific requirements of project materials and equipment. Ensure preservation requirements are integrated into the procurement, storage, and installation processes. Material Inspection and Tracking: Coordinate and Conduct inspections upon material and equipment delivery to verify compliance with preservation standards. Coordinate the Maintenance of records of material conditions, storage environments, and preservation activities in line with project documentation requirements. Environmental and Storage Control: Monitor and control environmental conditions (e.g., humidity, temperature, exposure) in storage and laydown areas. Collaborate with site teams to ensure proper storage, handling, and transport procedures. Preservation Maintenance Activities: Implement and oversee scheduled maintenance activities for materials and equipment during the construction phase. Ensure rotating equipment, electrical components, and sensitive materials are adequately protected and maintained.
  
**Coordination and Communication:** Liaise with vendors and suppliers to ensure preservation recommendations are followed. Coordinate with construction and commissioning teams to ensure preservation measures are continued until systems are fully operational. Compliance and Quality Assurance: Ensure adherence to project specifications, industry standards, and best practices in preservation. Conduct audits and inspections to verify the effectiveness of preservation measures. Training and Documentation: Provide training to site personnel on proper handling, storage, and preservation procedures. Maintain detailed records of preservation activities for project handover and audits.
  
  

**2. Qualifications:**  

**Educational & Professional:** Formal education in Mechanical, Electrical, or Civil Engineering, or related field. 10 years of experience in preservation engineering or a similar role within large-scale industrial projects (e.g., oil and gas, power generation, manufacturing plants). Strong knowledge of industry standards (e.g., API, ASTM, ASME). Familiarity with material preservation techniques for various components, including mechanical, electrical, and instrumentation systems. Proficient in using preservation management software and documentation systems. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Ability to analyze and mitigate risks associated with material deterioration. Ability to develop preservation requirements when not fully defined
  
**Interpersonal Skills:** Solution driven mindset Strong sense of Ownership Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities. High level of proactivity. Proficient with MS Office suite. General ability to use digital tools.

title: Mechatronic Verification Engineer
description:
Do you have a passion for precision, testing, and ensuring that complex mechatronic systems perform flawlessly in every condition? ALTEN is now looking for a Mechatronic Verification Engineer to join one of our major automotive clients in Gothenburg. This is an exciting opportunity for a skilled engineer who wants to work in a creative, collaborative, and multicultural environment — with the mission to ensure high-quality and reliable products through advanced testing and verification.

**About the role**


As a Mechatronic Verification Engineer, you will play a key role in the verification and validation process of mechatronic systems and components.  

You will contribute with your expertise in test method development, execution, analysis, and reporting to ensure system performance and compliance with industry standards.


You will be part of a highly skilled verification team that secures the quality of complete vehicle systems through both lab-based and real-world testing. Collaboration, innovation, and knowledge-sharing are central to the way we work — and you will be surrounded by supportive colleagues who strive for technical excellence and customer success.



**Key responsibilities**

* Develop, perform, and document verification tests for mechatronic systems
* Analyze measurement data and perform root cause analysis and corrective actions
* Validate power supply systems and optimize performance
* Work with vehicle communication systems (CAN/LIN)
* Perform ripple voltage measurement and parameter analysis
* Develop automated test procedures and reports
* Ensure compliance with IEC, ISO, and IEEE standards
* Collaborate cross-functionally with design, software, and system engineers to secure system functionality and quality

**Required qualifications**

* BSc or MSc in Electronics, Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent
* Experience working within mechatronic system testing and verification
* Strong knowledge of vehicle communication (CAN/LIN)
* Skilled in data analysis using Excel, Python, or equivalent tools
* Experience with powertrain systems or heavy vehicle components
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English, both spoken and written

**Meritorious experience**

* Experience with ECU applications and engine control systems
* Experience from testing or development within the automotive industry

**About you**


You are a structured and curious engineer with a service-minded attitude and strong analytical ability. You enjoy solving problems, sharing knowledge, and collaborating with others. You are comfortable working independently when needed and take ownership of your deliveries. Most importantly, you are passionate about technology, learning, and continuous improvement.

**What we offer**


At ALTEN, we believe in growing together. As part of one of Europe’s largest engineering and IT consulting companies, you will have the opportunity to take part in diverse projects across multiple industries and technologies.  

We offer an inspiring and supportive environment where your ideas and expertise are valued. Through ALTEN Academy, mentoring, and external training, we help you develop both professionally and personally.


This assignment is on-site in Gothenburg, at one of our major automotive clients. We review applications continuously and encourage you to apply as soon as possible!

**About ALTEN**


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest engineering and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in around 30 countries. Our engineers perform complex and highly technical projects throughout the entire product development cycle for leading companies in industries such as Automotive, Defence & Security, Energy, Industrial Equipment, Public Services, and Life Sciences.  

In Sweden, we are about 1,300 committed employees located in 9 cities — from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.  

For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award given to companies offering unique career and development opportunities.


Visit www.alten.se to learn more about us!

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
Board Intelligence is a technology and advisory firm that supercharges boards with the science of board effectiveness. We build better businesses and benefit society.


Through a suite of AI-powered software tools, evaluation frameworks, and advisory services that distil twenty years of boardroom experience, we improve the efficiency of board processes and the effectiveness of boards.


We work with over 70,000 leaders and 3,000 organisations across the world, with clients across the Fortune 500, FTSE 100, and OMX 30. In 2024 we received substantial backing from K1 Investment Management – the leading B2B Enterprise SaaS investors. We are at the beginning of significant growth, and we’re looking for superb talent to join us on this journey.


As we grow, we’re fiercely protective of our culture and values. Many of us, including our founders, have families and other priorities, so we know the value of a supportive company.


The team is diverse and friendly. We value fun: most days you’ll find a social event or learning opportunity to get involved with, including company socials, away days, philanthropic activities and lunch & learns.

**Our Mission**


We unleash the potential of organisations through the science of board effectiveness, building better businesses and benefiting society.

**Our Engineering Team**


Our Engineering team builds, maintains, and improve the software that our clients rely on. Our work ensures that Board Intelligence product suite is efficient, scalable, and capable of adapting to changing customer needs.

**The Role**


We are seeking a Security Engineer (Full-Stack) to help build and secure our SaaS solution. In this role, you will work closely with our development teams to embed security best practices into our full-stack applications, which leverage Java, Ruby, React, and other technologies. You will take a proactive approach to measuring/identifying vulnerabilities, designing secure architectures, and implementing security controls across the stack.

**What will you be responsible for?**

* + Secure full-stack applications written in Java (backend), Ruby (backend), and React (frontend)
	+ Implement and enforce secure coding practices in web applications and APIs
	+ Conduct threat modeling, code reviews, and security assessments
	+ Identify and remediate vulnerabilities in our SaaS infrastructure
	+ Develop security automation for detection and response mechanisms
	+ Collaborate with engineering, QA, and compliance teams to ensure security requirements are met
	+ Stay updated on emerging security threats and ensure compliance with security best practices (e.g., OWASP)

**Requirements**


We’re looking for someone that has a hunger to change our working environment for the better, driving performance from our people and protecting our culture and values to make sure we remain a caring, entrepreneurial and client-first workplace.


We’re open-minded on the background someone may have coming into this role, but things that could help a candidate to be successful would be:

* + Strong experience in **application security**
	+ Strong experience with securing web applications/APIs
	+ Familiarity with **authentication/authorization mechanisms** (OAuth, SAML, JWT)
	+ Proficiency in **penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and security tools**
	+ Strong problem-solving and communication skills
	+ Experience working/testing in a **SaaS-based, high-scale environment**
	+ Contributions to **open-source security projects** or relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, OSCP, CEH) is a plus

**Benefits**


We pride ourselves on our great working environment and package. Here’s some of what’s on offer:

* 25 days of Vacation with Advanced Vacation days
* Wellness benefits including a wellness hour per week for exercise and up to SEK 2,000 per year for wellness activities
* Parental leave with 90% salary coverage for up to 6 months (based on tenure)
* Comprehensive insurance including Group Life, TFA Safety and Travel
* Regular team lunches and fikas
* ITP1 + Flexpension
* Vision benefit with free eye test & terminal glasses
* Tax-free daily allowances for travel
* Activities such as conferences, kick-offs, and other events

title: Junior iOS Engineer
description:
Board Intelligence is a technology and advisory firm, that supercharges boards with the science of board effectiveness. We build better businesses and benefit society.


Through a suite of AI-powered software tools, evaluation frameworks, and advisory services that distil twenty years of boardroom experience, we improve the efficiency of board processes and the effectiveness of boards.

We are at the beginning of significant growth, and we are looking for superb talent to join us on this journey.


As we grow, we are fiercely protective of our culture and values. Many of us, including our founders, have families and other priorities, so we know the value of a supportive company.


With three international locations (UK, Sweden, Mauritius) and over 15 nationalities represented, the team is diverse and friendly. We value fun: most days you will find a social event or learning opportunity to get involved with, including company socials, away days, and philanthropic activities.

**Our Mission**


We unleash the potential of organisations through the science of board effectiveness, building better businesses and benefiting society.

**Our Engineering Team**


We build, maintain, and improve the software that our clients rely on. Our work ensures that Board Intelligence product suite is efficient, scalable, and capable of adapting to changing customer needs.

**The Opportunity**


At Board Intelligence, we're looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Junior iOS Engineer to join our expanding team. In this role, you'll be involved in the development and maintenance of our **iOS applications using Swift** (and potentially some Objective-C). Reporting to a Senior Engineer, you'll work with different teams, including Product, Design, and QA, to help build and deliver new features that support our company's aims.

**What Excites You**

* Write and maintain good quality code in **Objective C and/or Swift**
* Work with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and contribute to building new features for our product and users
* Participate in technical discussions and learn about the architecture of our mobile applications
* Take responsibility for specific tasks or smaller features, ensuring they meet our quality standards
* Learn from and be supported by senior engineers within the team
* Help to identify and fix bugs based on user feedback and testing
* Be encouraged to stay up-to-date with new technologies and best practices in the industry

**Requirements**

**What Excites Us**


We’re looking for someone that has a hunger to change our working environment for the better, driving performance from our people and protecting our culture and values to make sure we remain a caring, entrepreneurial and client-first workplace.


We’re open-minded on the background someone may have coming into this role, but things that could help a candidate to be successful would be:

* Experience with **Swift and the iOS environment**
* An understanding of the app development process would be a bonus
* A basic understanding of different ways to structure **iOS apps (like MVVM or MVC)** and a willingness to learn more about building scalable and maintainable applications
* A desire to contribute to good user experiences and the ability to work both independently on tasks and collaboratively within a team to solve problems
* A willingness to learn from and be supported by more senior developers and share knowledge as you grow
* An interest in maintaining good code quality and performance, and an openness to learning about tools like testing and code reviews

**Our iOS Tech Stack**

* Swift & Objective-C for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS Catalyst applications
* MVVM architecture with functional reactive programming patterns
* Realm database with encryption for local storage
* Cocoapods and Swift Package Manager for dependency management
* GitLab, JIRA, Confluence, Testflight, Fastlane for CI/CD and collaboration

**Benefits**


We pride ourselves on our great working environment and package. Here’s some of what’s on offer:

* 25 days of Vacation with Advanced Vacation days
* Wellness benefits including a wellness hour per week for exercise and up to SEK 2,000 per year for wellness activities
* Parental leave with 90% salary coverage for up to 6 months
* Comprehensive insurance including Group Life, TFA Safety and Travel
* Regular team lunches and fikas
* ITP1 + Flexpension
* Vision benefit with free eye test & terminal glasses
* Tax-free daily allowances for travel
* Activities such as conferences, kick-offs, and other events

title: Senior Staff Engineer
description:
As part of Wolt’s Platform department (Core Group), you will contribute to the reliability and scalability of our datastores, and work on the future unified storage platform we are building together with DoorDash.
  
We are looking for an experienced Staff Engineer specializing in storage reliability and building systems at scale to join the Platform department. In this role, you will lead the design and implementation of scalable platform solutions to support our e-commerce business, serving over 42 million monthly active users and 500,000+ merchants. As a Staff Engineer, you will define technical direction, mentor other engineers, and ensure our platform architecture can sustain rapid growth while staying reliable.
  
What you’ll be doing
  
**Technical Leadership:** Provide technical direction and leadership to multiple storage teams, set best practices for data storage. Oversee development and migration to the unified platform with DoorDash, ensuring high availability and data consistency.
  
**Growth Support:** Lead the design and development of a robust, scalable storage architecture that supports our business goals and organic growth.
  
**Mentor:** Mentor and guide engineers at various levels, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. Act as an evangelist for database optimization and best practices within the organization.
  
**Collaborate:** Work closely with Wolt and DoorDash teams responsible for foundational systems and services, such as compute and infrastructure, as well as product development teams, to ensure platform initiatives align with business goals and needs.
  
**Documentation:** Maintain comprehensive documentation of platform architecture, design decisions, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding. Participate in writing and reviewing RFCs.
  
**Security:** Support implementation of the security best practices to protect data and maintain the integrity of our platform in alignment with our Security Engineers.
  
**Observability:** Improve dashboards and alerts, and drive their adoption. Working together with the Observability team, ensure engineers have the tools and visibility needed to quickly detect, investigate, and resolve issues.
  
**Hands-on:** Work directly on implementation when needed, including POCs and debugging complex technical problems.
  
Our humble expectations
  
  

**Must haves:**  

2+ years of proven experience as a Technical Lead (e.g. Staff or Principal Engineer) in large-scale companies.
  
8+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
  
Deep understanding of non-relational databases (Cassandra preferred): best practices, performance optimization, data modeling, migration strategies, partitioning and sharding concepts.
  
Strong understanding of SRE and security best practices.
  
Proficiency in Go programming language.
  
Experience working with one of streaming platforms (Kafka and Kafka Connect preferred).
  
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  
Proactive, data-driven mindset with the ability to drive changes across the entire organisation.
  
Experience in supporting large-scale development teams across multiple locations.
  
  

**Nice to haves:**  

Experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred) and AWS RDS.
  
Knowledge of IaC tools (Terraform preferred) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes preferred).
  
Experience using Python for tasks and processes automation.
  
Familiarity with SOX compliance.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Ready to Launch Security Products for a Global Audience? We’re Hiring a Product Marketing Manager!What we do at Detectify
  
  

We're Detectify, and we're not your average cybersecurity company. We're a team who are obsessed with building cutting-edge tech that actually makes a difference in making the internet a safer place. We're talking about real-life hackers who know their stuff. You'll learn from the best, and maybe even develop some elite skills yourself.
  
  

Detectify offers cybersecurity solutions that combine human ingenuity with automation. We offer a solution that streamlines asset discovery and vulnerability assessments for AppSec teams.
  
  

What you’ll get to do
  
  

As our Product Marketing Manager, you will be the central hub connecting our product, marketing, and sales teams. You will be the expert on our customers and the market, using your insights to craft compelling narratives and launch products that resonate with a deeply technical audience.
  
  

**Some examples of your responsibilities:**  

* Launch Orchestration: Own and execute the end-to-end launch and GTM strategy for new product and feature launches, from positioning and initial messaging to post-launch analysis and optimization.
* Compelling Messaging: Develop crisp, technically-accurate messaging that translates Detectify’s capabilities into clear value propositions for different personas and use cases. You will craft the core messaging that forms the foundation of all our marketing and sales efforts.
* Sales Enablement: Partner closely with the sales team to arm them with the tools they need to win, including technical datasheets, competitive battle cards, demo scripts, and case studies.
* Content Collaboration: Act as the subject matter expert for the rest of the marketing team, collaborating with our Content and Demand Gen leads to fuel campaigns with product-centric stories, technical blog posts, and customer evidence.
* Market Intelligence: Be the voice of the customer and the expert on the market. Monitor our competitors, buyer trends, and our product's position to inform both the product roadmap and marketing strategy.Product Evangelism: Act as a key spokesperson for our products, with opportunities to represent Detectify at conferences, host technical webinars, drive analyst relations, and engage with the global security community.


Who you are
  
  

You are a "nerdy" and passionate product marketer who thrives at the intersection of technology and business. You have a proven track record of launching technical products and a gift for telling stories that connect with developers and security professionals.
  
  

* Several years of experience in product marketing, specifically within a B2B SaaS company targeting a technical buyer. Previous experience as a software engineer, DevRel, or technical sales engineer is a plus.
* Demonstrated success leading multiple GTM and product launch campaigns from start to finish.
* A strong technical acumen and genuine curiosity to dive deep into complex products. Demonstrated ability to work directly with engineering teams and translate technical concepts for diverse audiences. Cybersecurity experience is a huge plus.
* You are an exceptional storyteller and communicator, both in writing and in person, and are excited by the opportunity to be a public voice for the company.
* Proven track record executing GTM campaigns by creating alignment between Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing.
* An interest and curiosity in using AI to optimize marketing activities and integrate AI into your daily workflow is highly desirable.
* A proactive attitude, takes action quickly, and thrives in a fast-paced, self-managed environment.


So, what do you think?
  
  

We are proud to foster an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to be a part of changing the way the world thinks about security! Go hack yourself!
  
  

Remote work
  
  

We offer hybrid working and would like to see you a few days per week at our office in central Stockholm.
  
  

Started by a group of ethical hackers, Detectify offers cybersecurity solutions that combine human ingenuity with automation. We believe that the fear of cyber threats should never stand in the way of digital greatness.
  
  

At Detectify, your opinion and ideas matter. You'll belong to a diverse, dedicated, and forever curious team that recognizes the power of knowledge sharing and challenging the status quo.
  
  

Want to know more about what it is like working at Detectify? Visit our career site.

title: Junior Diagnostik ingenjör inom fordonsindustrin
description:
**Om tjänsten**  

Maxitech söker nu en diagnostikingenjör till en av Sveriges ledande industrikoncerner inom tunga fordon och maskiner. Uppdraget är placerat i Eskilstuna och innebär att arbeta i ett globalt utvecklingsteam som driver teknikskiftet mot en mer hållbar, uppkopplad och smart framtid.



Rollen är teoretiskt inriktad och innebär att utveckla och dokumentera strategier för felsökning och diagnos, samt att testa dessa på maskiner. Informationen som tas fram används sedan i eftermarknaden av servicetekniker världen över.



Detta är ett konsultuppdrag, vilket innebär att du kommer att bli anställd av oss på Maxitech. Om allt känns bra i samarbetet kan det finnas en möjlighet till överrekrytering till kunden på sikt.


**Du erbjuds**  

* En möjlighet att bli en del av ett globalt utvecklingsteam som arbetar med den senaste tekniken inom fordonselektronik och mekatronik.
* En roll med stort utrymme för lärande, samarbete och tekniskt ansvar.
* Generös kompetensutvecklingspott som du kan använda för att utveckla dina färdigheter

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

I rollen som diagnostikingenjör arbetar du nära mjukvaru- och systemutvecklare samt andra ingenjörer inom diagnos och verifiering. Du kommer att bidra till att förbättra felsökningsstödet redan under utvecklingsfasen och därmed lägga grunden för hög kvalitet i produktens hela livscykel. Arbetet präglas av samarbete, struktur och noggrannhet. Rollen är mer teoretisk än praktisk, men innehåller praktiska moment vid verifiering på maskin.  

Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar bland annat:  

* Analys av felkoder och uppbyggnad av felsökningsträd.
* Framtagning av teoretiska felsökningsstrategier och beställning av kodningsarbete till utvecklingsteam utomlands.
* Verifiering av implementerad felsökningslogik i maskiner.
* Dokumentation av resultat och felanalysstöd för eftermarknaden.

**Din profil**  

Krav:  

* Civil- eller högskoleingenjör inom mekatronik, elektronik, reglerteknik, maskinteknik eller motsvarande.
* Förståelse för fordonssystem, sensorer och kommunikationsprotokoll.
* God förmåga att läsa, analysera och dokumentera teknisk information.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift. Svenska är meriterande.


Meriterande:  

* Erfarenhet av diagnostik, test eller verifiering inom fordon eller maskin.
* Kännedom om embedded software och signalhantering.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) eller liknande testsystem.


Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, strukturerad och samarbetsvillig. Det krävs en analytisk förmåga och intresse för att förstå helheten i komplexa tekniska system – samtidigt som man kan fördjupa sig i detaljer. Rollen passar särskilt väl för en nyutexaminerad ingenjör med rätt tekniskt tänk och nyfikenhet på fordonsteknologi.


**Övrigt**  

Placering: Eskilstuna  

Start: Januari  

Omfattning: Heltid


**Om oss**  

Maxitech är ett konsultbolag inom IT/Tech som arbetar med branschens vassaste konsulter. Vi erbjuder även direktrekrytering till våra kunder och skräddarsyr lösningar efter deras behov.


  
Kategori
**Data/IT**
Tjänsten
**Civilingenjör**
Placeringsort
**Eskilstuna**
Yrkesområde
**Tillsvidareanställning**
Omfattning
**Heltid**
Sista ansökningsdag
**12/11/2025**

title: Executive assistant VP MACH
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


We are looking for an Executive Assistant to support our Vice President of MACH Products. You will become the right hand of the manager and provide executive support to maintain a high level of leadership – a central and important part of our Technology development journey.


You will have the joy of being the spider in the web, manage communication between upper management and employees, coordinating with internal and external executives on various projects & tasks and plan and orchestrate work to ensure that priorities are met, organizational goals are achieved, and best practices are upheld.


We offer you an exciting and dynamic role with close collaboration with customers, partners, other departments and teams at Hitachi Energy both locally and globally.

**How you'll make an impact**

* Main task is to manage professional and personal service support and scheduling for the manager, including agendas, mail, email, calls, travel arrangements, client management, and other company logistics
* Coordinate scheduling and extensive calendar management, as well as management of content and flow of information to senior executives
* Arrange internal/external events, for example travel arrangements, itineraries, accommodation, conferences, visiting speakers etc.
* Organize team communications and plan events, both internally and offsite
* Perform administrative and management support, such as Minutes of Meetings (MoM), preparation of presentations, spreadsheet creation and maintenance of administration systems
* Administration and coordination of signatures of various documents while keeping professionalism and confidentiality
* Research, compile, verify and analyse information and issue special reports, presentations, organization charts, process maps, correspondence, etc. Coordinate meetings, agendas, MoM, actions and follow-up

**Your background**

* You have been working as an Executive Assistant (or in a similar role) and you are comfortable in representing the executive office. You understand the dynamics of large cooperations and how to navigate in complex organizational matters
* You are eager to learn, always see opportunities in a challenge and you are a person that wants to make a difference
* Flexible and service-minded team player willing to adapt to changes and enjoys a challenge
* Social and positive. You enjoy working close to your manager and create a tight and efficient collaboration
* Hard working, willing to learn and have the ability to walk the extra mile when needed
* Time-management skills and the ability to organize, prioritize and coordinate multiple projects at once
* Great written and verbal communication skills, in English and Swedish
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems
* It is a merit to have knowledge about and experience of working in our business systems, for example eTime, Easy Procurement, Fieldglass, MyIS, Basware, Teams events, Visio
* Experience developing internal processes and filing systems is also a plus

**More about the role**

* The Vice President is travelling quite frequently, lots of cooperation & communication will be over phone, mail and other digital channels. For you this is not an issue as you are used to working independently.
* MACH is running operation in Sweden, Poland, India and China. Some business travel will be required,
* Workplace: Västerås or Ludvika

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement.
* Flexible working time.
* Health care and wellness allowance.
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally.
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase.
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development.
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden.
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave.
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks.
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role.

**More about us**


Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


More information: Recruiting Manager Peter Lundin, peter.lundin@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Pär Lyckbring, par.lyckbring@hitachienergy.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Konsultuppdrag | Senior Data Platform Engineer - (Nivå 5)
description:
**Start:** 2025-10-01 to 2026-03-31, med möjlighet om ytterligare 6 månader.

**Ort:** Stockholm/Hybrid

  

Vår kund genomgår en transformation av sitt digitala ekosystem — och data står i centrum.


Vi bygger en modern, decentraliserad dataplattform inspirerad av data mesh-principer, som ska ge teamen möjlighet att själva publicera, upptäcka och konsumera högkvalitativa dataset.


Vårt tvärfunktionella Foundry-team är ett hybridteam: vi bygger gemensamma plattformsfunktioner (katalog, governance, orkestrering, SDK:er), samtidigt som vi arbetar praktiskt med verkliga affärsfall för att hämta in, modellera och leverera dataprodukter. Det hjälper oss att validera plattformen och visa affärsvärde tidigt.  

Vi söker nu en Senior Data Platform Engineer som kan hjälpa oss att skala upp detta arbete. Du kommer bidra både till plattformsgrunden och till tidiga pilotprojekt — i nära samarbete med utvecklings- och analysteam för att leverera säkra, tillförlitliga och återanvändbara dataprodukter.  

  

**I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med...**  

* Ingestion och modellering av data: arbeta med verkliga dataanvändningsfall för att bygga pipelines, applicera anonymisering och skapa återanvändbara dataset i Databricks
* Bygga plattformsgrunden: designa och implementera säkra workspace-strukturer, strategier för Unity Catalog, åtkomstkontroller och orkestreringsmönster med hjälp av Azure-infrastruktur
* Skapa golden paths: definiera standardmönster och verktyg för publicering, versionering och konsumtion av dataset — inklusive SDK:er, dokumentation och mallar
* Operationalisera compliance: bygga in funktioner för integritet och governance i plattformen (t.ex. GDPR, RtBF, dataklassificering, anonymiseringsramverk)
* Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt: arbeta nära plattforms-, infrastruktur-, ingenjörs- och analysteam för att göra plattformen användbar, säker och värdeskapande från dag ett

  

**Du passar i rollen om du…**  

* Har 5+ års praktisk erfarenhet som software- eller data engineer, gärna i roller nära plattform/infrastruktur
* Har djup erfarenhet av Databricks, inklusive Unity Catalog, Delta Lake, workspace-setup och data engineering
* Är bekant med Azure, särskilt inom säker nätverksdesign, identitet (RBAC), lagring och VNet-setup
* Har jobbat med Terraform och Infrastructure as Code-verktyg
* Förstår data governance och integritetskrav — och har implementerat lösningar för anonymisering, pseudonymisering eller åtkomstkontroll
* Har erfarenhet av orkestrering av pipelines och jobb i Databricks-miljö
* Är bekväm med Python och SQL, samt CLI-verktyg och Git-baserade arbetsflöden
* Är pragmatisk — du balanserar struktur och snabbhet, och gillar att leverera iterativt
* Gillar att samarbeta mellan team, dokumentera ditt arbete och hjälpa andra att lyckas

  

**Extra plus om du…**  

* Har byggt eller integrerat datasetkataloger, verktyg för metadataspårning eller Backstage-plugins
* Har kunskap om data mesh, intern plattformsdesign eller developer experience
* Har erfarenhet av Power BI, datamodellering för analys och slutanvändares databehov
 **Om oss**

*Senterprise är ett ledande rekryteringsbolag inom IT och en oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter. Med aktiv headhunting, search och djup teknisk förståelse hjälper vi några av Sveriges främsta arbetsgivare att hitta rätt kandidater, både för anställning och konsultuppdrag.*

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Warranty Project Engineer, Finspång
description:
**About Justera Group**  

Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.  

  

**About the Role:**  

A Snapshot of Your Day - Join a role where your expertise in gas turbines is not just appreciated but celebrated. As a Warranty Project Engineer, you’ll collaborate closely with the warranty project leader and logistic planner, playing a pivotal role in our Technical Support team. Your day will be filled with dynamic problem-solving, providing top-notch global support, and adapting to the ever-changing demands of our turbines and customers. Located in our Finspång office, you’ll be at the heart of innovative projects, making a significant impact on global customer satisfaction.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Support and advise the warranty project leader with your technical expertise, ensuring the success and efficiency of crucial projects.  

	+ Coordinate and lead technical investigations to resolution and implementation on site, collaborating seamlessly with relevant departments and personnel.
	+ Understand customer requirements, implement them effectively, and guarantee customer satisfaction, thereby directly contributing to the company’s reputation and excellence.
* 

**Requirements:**

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, or related), or equivalent experience.  

	+ Extensive expertise in gas turbines, particularly Siemens Energy MGT fleet like SGT600/700/750 and 800.
	+ Proficiency in IT systems and software, especially SAP, PLM2020, and Microsoft Office.
	+ Excellent communication skills in English; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.
	+ Ability to coordinate technical issues, conduct meetings, and present technical scopes to customers.
* 

**What We Offer:**

  

* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Har 5+ års praktisk erfarenhet som software- eller data engineer, gärna i roller nära plattform/infrastruktur
* Har djup erfarenhet av Databricks, inklusive Unity Catalog, Delta Lake, workspace-setup och data engineering
* Är bekant med Azure, särskilt inom säker nätverksdesign, identitet (RBAC), lagring och VNet-setup
* Har jobbat med Terraform och Infrastructure as Code-verktyg
* Förstår data governance och integritetskrav — och har implementerat lösningar för anonymisering, pseudonymisering eller åtkomstkontroll
* Har erfarenhet av orkestrering av pipelines och jobb i Databricks-miljö
* Är bekväm med Python och SQL, samt CLI-verktyg och Git-baserade arbetsflöden
* Är pragmatisk — du balanserar struktur och snabbhet, och gillar att leverera iterativt
* Gillar att samarbeta mellan team, dokumentera ditt arbete och hjälpa andra att lyckas

  

**Meriterande**  

* Har byggt eller integrerat datasetkataloger, verktyg för metadataspårning eller Backstage-plugins
* Har kunskap om data mesh, intern plattformsdesign eller developer experience
* Har erfarenhet av Power BI, datamodellering för analys och slutanvändares databehov

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 20-10-2025 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
At Svea Solar, we have a clear vision - to fix the planet. As Sweden’s and one of Europe’s leading players in energy technology, we are driving the energy transition with solar power and smart energy solutions. ⚡
   

  

 We’re now expanding our website team with an
 **Fullstack Engineer** 
 . Are you ready to join the Power Shift?
   

  

**About The Role & The Team**
 As our
 **Fullstack Engineer (with a frontend focus)** 
 in the Website team, you’ll be part of a talented and ambitious agile team. Together you’ll design and implement technical solutions for Svea Solar’s website and related areas, ensuring a seamless experience between our site and our smart energy platform
 *Sunbeam* 
 .
   

  

 You’ll work closely with another Teach lead, a frontend engineer, an analyst, and a product manager, reporting to our Engineering Manager Anna. We follow a collaboration-first approach, working three days a week from our Stockholm office.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* Build and maintain both frontend and backend features, with a strong focus on frontend.
* Develop modern, accessible, and semantically correct websites using HTML5 and CSS3 (SASS).
* Write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code in TypeScript/JavaScript and React.js.
* Design and implement REST APIs and integrations with our CMS written in Python.
* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and fellow engineers to create functional and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural discussions and best practices, supporting long-term scalability and event-driven design.


 Are we a match?
   

  

**We’re Looking For You Who…**
* Value team success over personal success and thrive in a collaborative dynamic environment.
* Have at least 5 years of professional experience in software development, including at least 2 years in backend.
* Have strong experience with: TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express, REST APIs, CMS, and event-driven design.
* Have solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and SASS.
* Are fluent in English and Swedish.


**Bonus points if you..**
* Have experience with Next.js, i18next, Motion/React Spring, Tailwind, Styled-components.
* Are comfortable with Python, Django, Wagtail, or Deno.


 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - What do we offer you
   

  

**The opportunity to make an impact** 
 – your work directly contributes to fixing the planet and driving the energy transition.
   

  

**About**
**A value-driven workplace** 
 – read more about our values here.
   

  

**The chance to own your results** 
 – grow, take responsibility, and power up as both we and the energy industry evolve.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusivity** 
 – different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you can be yourself and contribute with your experiences, identities, and ideas.
   

  

**Employment benefits** 
 – occupational pension, 30 days of vacation, wellness allowance, parking, and more.
   

  

**Flexibility/ hybrid work** 
 – work up to two days a week from home.
   

  

 Want to see what life at Svea Solar really looks like? Follow us on Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 ⚡Who are we
   

  

 As Sweden’s - and one of Europe’s - leading providers of energy tech and solar, we help our customers optimize their energy use with smart, connected solutions. From solar panels to heat pumps, batteries, EV chargers, and software, we’re shaping the future of energy. We call it
 **The Power Shift** 
 . And the ones driving it?
 **Power Shifters** 
 .
   

  

  

  

**About Our Recruitment Process**
* With structured interviews and assessments through Alva Labs, we make sure our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, and unbiased - because diversity is key to innovation!
* Read more about our Recruitment process here.


 👉
 **Ready to become a Power Shifter?** 
 We review applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to send yours in!

title: Fullstack Java-utvecklare
description:
**Din Roll Och Uppgifter**
 Vi söker nu dig som vill vara en del av att bygga ett spännande bolag som konsult men också vara med att forma vår egen produkt. Vi tror att du är kreativ i ditt tänkande och kan komma med förslag på hur vi bör utforma vår tekniska miljö och vår produkt.
   

  

 Du kommer bli anställd som konsult, där du i huvudsak kommer sitta ute hos kunder och hjälpa dem med deras produkter.
   

  

 Som Utvecklare Kommer Du Förmodligen Jobba Eller Ha Kännedom Av Hela Teknik Stacken, Vanliga Tekniker, Verktyg Och Buzzwords i Våra Uppdrag Är
   

  

* Javascript, Angular, React eller Vue.js
* AWS eller Google Cloud
